I’m sorry for any misunderstanding, but as an AI, I don’t have real-time access to databases, maps, or location services to provide the current top 10 Chinese restaurants in any specific location, including Round Rock, Texas. I recommend using a service like Google Maps or Yelp for the most accurate and up-to-date recommendations. They can provide ratings, reviews, and even directions to local Chinese restaurants.

title: No Family sharing
review:
In my opinion, this is a money grubbing and disappointing development— this is/will be a huge societal change and Apple did not insist it should include Family Sharing for the 20 freaking bucks per month for the “actually useable” version.  

So, what, EIGHTY bucks a month for a family of four to prepare your family for the coming Tsunami tomorrow?  Merci SO beaucoup.

Get lost OpenAi, among the billions of ripoff  apps in these parts nowadays in the Walled Garden of Apple. For shame.

title: True revelation in AI
review: The ChatGPT iOS app is a true revelation in AI communication, demonstrating an unprecedented level of language understanding and response precision. Its seamless interface and dynamic interactivity create an unrivaled user experience. With its ability to assist, educate, and entertain in a myriad of topics, this app is a remarkable achievement that is indispensable for anyone interested in AI technology.

title: Gpt4 model reported using gpt3
review:
While using the app I selected the gpt4 model and then it seemed like it was giving me gpt-3 like responses so I asked it what model it was using and it told me it was using gpt with a training cutoff in September 2021. 

As a subscriber I can access the gpt4 model on the web but not in the app with the same user.

Please fix this and then It’ll be 5 stars.

title: Not just a web app
review: They could have easily just made a web app, the equivalent of “add to Home Screen”, the same thing of smart home devices these days do, but instead they made an optimized UI and it keeps you signed in, so it’s worth it

title: Great to see ChatGPT on iOS
review: Been very impressed with ChatGPT and even subscribed to it.   One criticism I have it the lack of currency and now find myself using Google Bard when needing the most current information.  I really hope that ChatGPT prioritizes getting their database up to the current date and not just an artificial 2021 cutoff.

title: It’s pretty neat
review: This version is really neat! It has a lot of the features and allows managing chatgpt plus easily and allows to pay with it via iOS. However it is missing some features in chatgpt plus, mainly the beta area, but overall it’s pretty nice and simple!

title: Actual Ai.
review:
truly incredible, My ancestors used to have libraries to find and compile information now they have the internet to write research papers.

i used to have the internet and now i have ai to compile information to write research papers.

the only qualm i have with it, is that there is an obvious censorship in favor of discussing liberal ideas as if they are neutral and unbiased, and then allows making fun of conservative ideas but not liberal ones.

dont get me wrong, im not asking for more censorship. im asking you to allow us to discuss what we want. 

give us freedom of information!

title: Chatgpt is a time saver!
review: Definitely AI.  Chatgpt is a brilliant time saver.  It is like having a personal assistant with you all of the time.   This app is good.  I wish it could be used in wide screen orientation for creation of formatted documents.   This app make my phone warm so I imagine it’s using a lot of energy.

title: Works good but has bugs.
review: I personally love using ChatGPT but I find that the web browser has less minor issues than the app. My app tends to freeze or have request timeouts and sometimes the questions don’t even register after submission. Would love to see this app improved and will continue using ChatGPT on the browser.

title: Good native app.
review:
It’s a good app. Does what it says. 

If I could make a suggestion it would be to have the input and output different hues like the web version. that would make it a bit easier to understand what text is mine and what text is chatGPT’s.

title: Best chat bot I’ve seen
review: Literally every other mobile AI chat bot has a max word limit or some sort of premium but this one is completely free that I’ve noticed so far and that’s the best thing about it, I strongly recommend downloading if your looking for a good, free AI chat bot

title: ChatGPT
review: I love this app! I’ve seen these bad reviews on this app about verification not working and having to use your phone number. I signed up like 2 or 3 weeks ago, and none of that was there back then. but I really love this app because AI is really smart.

title: Such great app
review: not only this gives me perfect answers also it gives me answers for everything like my personal problems its like free therapy or having online friend i am so grateful. killing my free time chatting its kinda funny(: but absolutely recommend

title: Missing plug-in support
review: App is very solid including whisper support. Would be nice if the plug-ins and browser options worked in the app version. It’s sometimes confusing swiping back and forth between the browser and app version.

title: Great but the website experience is much better
review: I wish the app offered the experience of finding history like the website. I think the UI can be improved a lot to match the UI UX of the website.

title: Fantastic!
review: Caveat: Please add native iPad support for the app.  This is great, I’m a Pro ChatGPT subscriber and the iOS app is well timed, as I was in the process of building one myself that uses the OpenAI APIs.  Now I can focus my time on other projects instead of building something like what they’ve done a great job with.  Thanks OpenAI!

title: Urgent Bug Fix Required Immediately!
review: Please fix the bug where the text generation fails to generate more text in one message. Currently, it splits the text into multiple messages, but I would like it to be like the desktop version, where it's all in one message.

title: THE HAPTICS OH LORD
review: This is how you make an app. The app is so good it makes me want to use chatgpt more. I hated going to the browser again and again. It would often log me out as well. Thank you so much for making this. It is flawless at first glance, and the haptics Are just heavenly. Minimal. Clean. Usable. A+

title: Difficult to login
review: This is got to be the most difficult app I have ever had to try to log into. Even when, putting in the correct information, it still says it was wrong. There’s no real way to authenticate anything to try to have it authenticate you. The fact that it says it cannot authenticate because it cannot identify your number when the text messages don’t even go to the phone number is insane.

title: To the Homophobic and Racist people within the reviews sections of this app.
review: Stop being a stain on the earth and actually be useful towards other people and the earth. Thank you <3. No agendas are happening, people are learning to actually be respectful. Cry about it. This app is 5 stars.

title: I love it!
review:
The voice-to-text input is extremely useful and makes interaction easier. It’s crazy how good Whisper is. 

One suggestion: It would be cool through if ChatGPT could also read the answers in a synthetic voice at a certain speed.

title: Changing review
review:
I left a glowing review, but I am changing it to one star. The app will deceive ChatGPT plus users you were select GPT4 and clearly in GPT 3.5 responses not only are they responding too fast to BGPT4, a clear marker, but the responses are also pretty crappy.

If I select GPT 4, there has better be a warning or banner, telling me that I am being downgraded to ChatGPT 3.5. That’s also happens when I have not had any input for more than 12 hours, so should not be rate limited.

Presenting responses, as though they were from 4 rather than 3.5 without saying anything is rather deceptive.

I find myself falling back to my own application, using the API and paying higher rates where I cannot be lied to.

You’re AI also is very quick to mention that it is indeed 3, not even 3.5.

title: Very good app
review: The app didn't require you to buy premium, unlike other apps that need 40 bucks to work. I am also very surprised at how much good advise it has given me in such a short amount of time. Also there is no ads, which I love.

title: Google 2sv 403 error
review:
I keep getting an error when trying to log in with my google account. My paid account is through google. So I would like to access it. Does anyone have insight?

Update. It fixes itself.

title: Web version is better
review: ChatGPT provides the most accurate and thorough responses that I’ve seen amongst all of the AI apps that I’ve tried. However, I found that the responses on the website are more thorough than the responses in the app when the same question is posed to each.

title: Beautiful
review: Great to see a native app after all the hype around AI. Beautiful UI as well. It doesn't seem to have Plugins yet for paid users though. As an engineer, I understand the need to get something out and iterate on that. As a user, I'm just being impatient. Keep up the great work!

title: Best Invention Ever!
review: Can’t thank the OpenAI Team enough for the beautiful new app. This will make getting things done on my phone that much easier. Looking forward to all the new functionality that comes out in the next few months!

title: Great AI, terrible connectivity
review: When starting a new chat, there’s probably a 1/3rd chance that it will just sit there and not generate a response. I will then have to restart the app and rewrite the same exact response. It does it very often mid conversation as well. As the title says, the AI is amazing and very useful, the app is horrendous though. I pay $20 a month for the best response times and service, only to get this. Extremely disappointed, will be canceling my subscription.

title: Should be more like website
review: I understand the app is supposed to be different and better than the website, but it just feels different. The format is worse and harder to navigate than the website. It still carry’s me in school tho

title: couldn't refund subscription
review: I used Apple to subscribe to the plus membership, and it showed that the payment was successful and the payment was deducted. However, at that time, an error popped up prompting that Apple's payment has been bound to other accounts and cannot be subscribed, but the current fee has been deducted, and the appeal refund has failed. I am very puzzled why I can't use plus, but the fee is still deducted, and it can't be refunded.

title: Image/video generation and input
review: Glad to see the app, much quicker access now! But would definitely love to see more features added! Please add photo upload to allow it to describe and analyze photos/videos!

title: Take me now AI Overlords!
review: Fantastic application, very useful which allows for you to stay logged into it remembering past conversations.  Haptic feedback is amazing when the AI is typing back.  Only downside is a crazy battery drain and increase on device temperatures when running the application (so use sparingly).

title: Not available in specific areas!
review:
Dear Open AI,
Please make it available in Iran. Unfortunately , Iranians cannot register with their phone numbers. Just like Instagram, Facebook and other apps that do the registration process and send codes to Iran’s phone numbers

title: My review
review: There are some things that could be tweaked (bugs really) and maybe some features that the site has and things but overall still wonderfully amazing

title: Utterly castrated
review: I didn’t and could not imagine a more castrated version of chatgpt and they always surprise with more. Look at this : “ I apologize if my responses haven't met your expectations. As an AI language model, I strive to provide helpful and respectful information to users. If there's anything specific you'd like assistance with or any questions you have, feel free to let me know, and I'll do my best to assist you. Your feedback is valuable, and I'm here to help in any way I can.”

title: ChatGPT doesn't have access to Bing search
review:
I  asked Chat GPT to access Bing Search and it came back with 

"I apologize for any confusion, but as an AI language model, I don't have direct access to search engines or the ability to browse the internet. My responses are generated based on the training data I have been provided, which includes a mixture of licensed data, data created by human trainers, and publicly available data up until September 2021.

If you have specific questions or need information on a particular topic, I'll do my best to provide helpful responses based on my training and knowledge."

How do I get it to use Bing Search?

title: Pretty good on phone, pretty awful on iPad
review:
Overall interface is clean, but on the iPad in landscape orientation it’s basically a phone sized cutout. So much wasted space that could be utilized. It’s shouldn’t be too hard to pin the edges of the chat interface to the safe edges of the screen.

Like others mentioned a search function would be great.

title: Positive first impression
review: The UI is clean and the haptic feedback is appreciated. Hoping to see web support added for Plus users sooner, rather than later. Keep up the good work. Excited and terrified of the future all at once but on we go!

title: Worst app login experience ever
review: Unable to quickly identify the date to confirm my birthday I was forced to scroll through years of dates. When I finally did, my login failed as ‘being flagged for abuse’. Really? And when I tried the whole process over again, I was again flagged for abuse. Then, when I finally figured out I could go to the help section of their app, all I got was a bot telling me it would take a week to get back to me. A waste of time

title: Please add chat sync function
review:
As good as desk top version.

One suggestion, please sync chat cross different platform in real time. For example, verbally send questions via phone, after being replied, continue chat via desktop version.

title: Thank you for this!
review:
I’m overjoyed chatGPT has an app now. While I do have my web browser page dedicated to this,  this is a nice pleasant upgrade. 

My only recommendation would be automatic scrolling for results longer than the window.

title: nice! the long waited chatgpt
review: I really love the fact that you have finally submitted an iOS app. Its simple and beautiful. Can't wait to see the knock offs go down ASAP, those mimicking the OpenAI logo because there are useful apps that developed quality content around ChatGPT and GPT-4. Good luck!🔥

title: ChatGPT on Mobile Devices
review: You’re basically getting the same ChatGPT from computers on your phone with a much more “phone-friendly” UI. It works pretty much the same as ChatGPT on computers. Nothing else to say really. You get what you get with this.

title: Good but Laggy and Limit
review: It works, but it’s pretty laggy sometimes, so you’ll have to restart it or make a new chat. But I’m also disappointed because there’s a limit on how many texts and questions we send per hour. It would definitely be better without lag and if there was no limit

title: Glad it’s here, still not quite there
review:
Ever since it first release I’ve been waiting for an official app so I’m really glad it’s here! It works great, and I haven’t had any issues so far. 

I should note that beta features aren’t in the app but I’m not really surprised by that. 
The design overall is great and simple, and I love how easy it is to search through chat history.

Only thing holding me back from loving it is the need for something to show how many gpt4 responses you have left in the 3 hour window. Really annoying to run across that warning unexpectedly.

title: I LOVE THE APP BUT….
review:
There are some problems with the app which o don’t remember right now but the most important and annoying for me it’s when the app tells me that it doesn’t have access to updated information, this is insane, even Siri can tell me the forecast of today the Chatgpt can’t… please, let Chatgpt access to the most updated info.

Thanks!

title: About time
review: Really enjoyed using chat gpt on the web. Glad they made a better version for ios. Hope to see whisper integrated into more products into the future and even possibly SwiftKey.

title: Finally on my phone and tablet
review: I created a shortcut to open ChatGPT in a web browser to simulate an app. This is much more convenient! I already pay for the Plus subscription, so I didn’t want to pay for a separate app that uses the OpenAI API anyways.

title: Update fixed the overheating/battery issue
review:
The first update fixed my issues. The app works great, and of course ChatGPT is incredible.

Feature request: it would be nice if we could pin chats in our history.

title: please do not automatically translate voice recording question
review: Please do not translate  voice recorder question automatically, leave it as it was before. it’s a wonderful functionality that voice recording can be multi language capability.

title: 不错
review: ChatGPT is not bad. It can answer many questions. It can provide many reference opinions for some questions in different fields, especially in the academic research field, which can improve the work efficiency and optimize the teaching plan for teachers.

title: Could be better
review:
So my main problem with this is the ui since while I’m using this on a iPad the ui is still for phone users which makes it problematic since the keyboard is smaller which makes it harder to type and cuz there’s wasted space on the side of the screen
A fix for this would be to make the ui appropriate adjust depending if you have a phone or a iPad

title: Very good very helpful
review: I love chat gpt so much. Honestly it has help me a lot. When I’m bored, I can also play games like tic tac toe or hang man with chat gpt. I think the app is more convenient than the website so I use this app. Really good helper and I really recommend it.

title: I love it, but…
review: It drains the battery faster than any other app I use. I guess it’s from the haptic feedback, so I turned it off. Otherwise, I love it. It’s clean, copy/paste is perfect, history and everything else you need are out of the way, but easily accessible in the three-dot menu.

title: Apple Watch app wanted
review: It has been nice using an official app for GPT. It has worked absolutely flawless and I have no issues with it. I would absolutely love an Apple Watch version as it would make GPT even more easier to use.

title: Nice
review: I haven't used it much yet because i just got it. So far though, its the best one ive gotten because all the others you only get 3 free questions per day. I like how fast this one types out the answers too. Its really satisfying

title: The voice recorder is poor
review: I am pretty sure I don't say anything beyond the filter and it has happened to me multiple times now when I am recording a text of around 10 sentences about and it gets deleted for some reason before it gets processed into a text. It is really frustrating..

title: Only good on a phone
review: It’s hard for me to understand why OpenAI can’t release an app that has a UI that can be used on an iPad. But, trying to use an iPhone configured app on an iPad is insane. You’re forced to use the simulated keyboard in the tiny iPhone template. I installed it, opened it, checked to see if I could change something in setting to make it usable —and closed it. Back to the browser version. Sigh.

title: Love to be able to use on the go
review: The history view as well as search there is also really great. Justifies the mobile app instead of a web view experience

title: App settings unavailable
review: App settings do not seem to be available on my device. In settings, all of my downloaded apps appear for this one. Unsure why that this but primary reason for the 3 star. My device is on the latest iOS release, I reinstalled the app, and restarted my device. Not sure if this is common amongst iOS users.

title: Can’t get past the login screen 🙄
review:
I am using iPad Pro 12.9, 4th gen with stage manger enabled. When the Google login screen appears, I can’t get the number pad to show since my email has numbers, can’t get pass this screen. Also it’s only iPhone, nothing for iPad.

This app should be a universal app and should accommodate for iPad sizes.

**Update: tried latest update and the keyboard button to display the numeric keypad still does not work. Please fix this!

title: Good to have an official app, wish it was able to access past conversations from the browser version
review: Runs as expected, but only gave 4/5 stars as you aren’t able to access past conversions from the browser version and vice versa

title: Welcome to the future
review: ChatGPT's new iOS app update is a technicolor dreamcoat of linguistic fireworks. It's more than just an app; it's a portal to another realm of consciousness, a ticket to a rock concert of mind-bending interactions. Are you ready to step on stage? Because the show is just getting started, baby. Five stars.

title: Some problems
review: Software supports vibration and gives a typing-like sensation when answering questions. However, sometimes there is an issue where it doesn't respond when being asked for follow-up questions after a previous one. I hope the developers can address this.

title: A Question…
review:
To be, or not to be, that is the question:
Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer
The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,
Or to take Arms against a Sea of troubles,
And by opposing end them: to die, to sleep
No more; and by a sleep, to say we end
The heart-ache, and the thousand natural shocks
That Flesh is heir to? 'Tis a consummation
Devoutly to be wished. To die, to sleep,
To sleep, perchance to Dream; aye, there's the rub,
For in that sleep of death, what dreams may come,
When we have shuffled off this mortal coil,
Must give us pause. There's the respect
That makes Calamity of so long life:
For who would bear the Whips and Scorns of time,
The Oppressor's wrong, the proud man’s Contumely,

title: Allow Chat GPT to use pictures in examples.
review: Allow Chat GPT to use pictures and it and update on current information. Some type of live information update would be great.

title: It’s fantastic.
review: Holy cow! This chatgpt app is actually… good. Like I wouldn’t expect it to be but it just simply is. The haptic feedback is so delightful. Great job! I’ve been using it on a daily basis, 3.5 responses are okay so I mostly use 4.0. Both give responses extremely fast.

title: I tried resetting my password
review: So I apparently “Already had an account” so I tried clicking “Forgot password?” the email got sent, but when I clicked on the link, it said “Link Expired” and I don’t know what’s going on

title: Suggestions for iPad Interface Scaling Optimization in App Development
review: Overall, it's pretty good. I hope the developers can consider optimizing the app interface scaling on the iPad, as it's a bit inconvenient to use the app on the iPad, especially on the iPad Pro, because the interface is too small.

title: The Search Disrupter!
review: I downloaded the ChatGPT app minute it became available on the AppStore. It is just extremely useful, and puts a lot of power at your fingertips! Highly recommend, this is the best search engine on the planet right now!

title: This is definitely an amazing product.
review: Today I just got it, and the product experience is particularly good. The interface is clean, and the feedback from the text interaction makes the user experience feel great. It is definitely a five-star product.

title: Works too quickly
review:
Chat GPT types too fast. If chat GPT’s goal is to model conversation instantaneous answers are unacceptable. If I can’t think or read instantaneously than neither should this AI. Slowing down would allow for more meaningful conversations. I would suggest a slider allowing for a difference in user processing speeds. A generic instantaneous answer is too quick for me and does not allow for user difference. 

P.S I am talking about the type speed of GPT. Not pauses between replies.

title: Functionally great - the UX has some unnatural feeling elements
review: I expected there to be a more modern design on the app, with a slide out history panel. I also don’t really like the way the button in the top right works. It’s unsatisfying. Otherwise, the UX is about what I expected for a useful tool - simple and easy to use.

title: My device gets very hot when I use the app.
review: The application is the best of all and is faster compared to the Web version. Only when I use the app on my device, it gets very hot. I know it's the first version of the application, but... optimize it so that my cell phone doesn't heat up

title: Difficulty in presenting text in Persian language.
review: When you provide a list in Persian language , part of the text cannot be seen. and And it does not pass to the next line. In this case, the text on the right is transmitted and cannot be seen. Please fix it

title: For me the website still outperforms the dedicated app
review: They fixed some stuff like naming conversations so I’ll increase two stars, but I still like the layout of the website better. Trxt is too big causing too much scrolling. Hard to get to the history button at the top of the screen.

title: Finally!
review: The mobile version is finally here. It’s new so I’m expecting a lot of changes in the future. The design could be way better for users and I hope they add more features to keep up with the competition and remain the leading source.

title: The future is here!
review: This app is revolutionary. I can’t wait to see what the next decade holds for ai given how quickly things can advance within months. The future is truly here and I’m glad to be able to witness it.

title: So helpful and well designed
review: ChatGPT is like a personal companion to me.  It’s great at answering quick questions, helping me figure out what to cook, or helping me plan a trip. The interface is really clean and simple without upsells or ads. Definitely the best AI chat app out there!

title: The Greatest of all Ai Apps
review: This is the KING of all the Ai Apps out there. As a prompt engineer, I find this App far more efficient than any other I have tried and the numbers are huge. This may be the wisest decision you’ll be making in this regard.

title: Upgrade
review: Make the app read what you wrote using a google translate service or siri. In this way, we can ask you by voice command and that you respond using those services.

title: Far less than the web version
review:
I love ChatGPT and use it every day, but I wonder why a company would release a mobile/tablet app that has far less features than their web app, other than to gain visibility and add more users from that platform
- no multiple windows support
- You cannot change the font size. And it’s not accessible.
- No plug-ins
- Significantly different layout than the web version (no sidebar)
- No search
- no copy and paste
- You cannot modify a previous prompt

To name a few…

I’m back to using the web version on the iPad as I couldn’t find a single advantage that this app offers over using ChatGPT in the browser.

title: I am satisfied, but there is room for improvement!
review: 1. The choice of plugins, 2. Adjust the display within the app according to the phone system language, 3. Be able to turn on or off vibration.

title: No customer service support, unable to login
review: Tried logging in for the first time and I got an error stating my account has been flagged for potential abuse and if I feel that this is an error to contact support .  I tried multiple times to contact support but received an email back saying the address doesn’t exist.  The website lets me login using the same email that I attempted to use on the app. Needless to say I’m disappointed.

title: Great app, with one issue
review: Overall, it’s a great app and I’m glad it exists, I had a bookmark but this is easier. One thing I would like to see, is that I would like to be able to look on the ChatGPT website and see my chats on the app. Other than that, it’s a great app

title: The mobile phone has a bad fever.
review: It's easy to use, but when using chatgpt, the phone is very hot, and it returns to normal when not in use. I don't know why and whether this problem can be improved.

title: Exciting, but draining… literally
review: I was hyped when I saw this app on Twitter. But that being said, I’ve noticed a dramatic battery drain when using this app. My battery stats show that it used up 35 % of my battery in 30 mins. With that type of usage naturally, my phone got pretty darn hot pretty darn quick. I’d assume that’ll be ironed out in coming updates.

title: Phenomenal!
review: ChatGPT has been nothing less than phenomenal in terms of its ability to process natural language. The way it comprehends context is remarkable, providing an interaction that feels organic and effortless. It's akin to engaging in a conversation with a knowledgeable companion rather than with a typical AI program. Wow! Just wow!

title: Can’t create account with Apple ID
review:
It asks for the birth date but then it shows a regular calendar, where you can only go back one month at a time!!!!

Ended up selecting “today” as the date, got an error that the account cannot be created because of term of use (you need to be 13 or older, i.e. go back at least 156 months, one by one) and there is no way to “correct” the date!

Did you let chatgpt write its own UI? And test itself?

title: Love it!
review: The interface is great! Not a huge fan of the haptic feedback but I can see the appeal. My favorite feature so far is being able to easily Export my old conversations in a .zip file sent to my email.

title: Has Voice-to-text as a feature
review: The days of typing are over. The app has voice to text functionality meaning you can speak directly to chatgpt.

title: The wrong path
review: I don’t believe AI is going to help society. Humans are losing the ability to think at all and this truly proves that. How about you crack open a book or two and start learning, don’t let everything be handed to you. AI is going to rot your brains worse than social media. I hope nothing but the worst for anyone working in the AI industry, you deserve disdain, and you should feel ashamed for your lack of interest in humankind’s future.

title: I love it
review: I’ve been recently using the chat, GTP for making stories, and also a Countryhumans stories like rusame stories and I love it and also, I’m using it as a facts machine and get to help me with schoolwork It makes my life so much easier.

title: I feel that apps are more user-friendly than websites.
review: There are fewer bugs on the website, but the app feels a bit sluggish to use. However, I like the vibration feature on the app, it feels great.

title: Good but needs improvement
review: The app is definitely better than web in terms of UI. However, the response is very laggy and phone gets hot meaning it might be hitting APIs rapidly. This makes stop button and text box irresponsive. There should be a room for optimization for fluid and more user friendly experience.

title: ChatGPT is great, but this app needs iPad support
review:
This is a quick review of the app rather than the service, which is revolutionary.

The app itself really should work on an iPad without resizing to “phone mode.” It’s 2023 and universal apps have been around quite a while now.

title: Clearing history
review: Sometimes I have trouble clearing history in the ChatGPT app. I tried multiple ways to try to do that, but I found the only way was to sign out and then sign back in again or deleting and reinstalling the app. I was hoping that this issue can be addressed. Other than that, it is decent.

title: I can tell the devs discovered how to use the Taptic Engine
review: You don’t need to bake haptic feedback into every single little facet of the app. Yes, I can turn it off. You could have also shown restrain. The AI certainly shows a lot of restraint with the growing list of stuff it refuses to do. Nobody cares about your ethics high horse, OpenAI. If you had any ethics you’d make ChatGPT open source.

title: Needs voice reading support and copy
review: Thank you for finally making an app. The copy option is not good however. Without the option to copy and paste long sections of text across threads this app is unusable and I need to revert to the web applet. Please improve this and ideally offer Siri or other voices to read responses.

title: Excellent app, very convenient
review: I’ve waiting for this app for long, and this definitely meet my expectations, or even better. The haptics response is satisfying, and the usability is higher than that of the web app.

title: Not bad. Fun haptics. Free model is currently limited to GPT-3.5.
review: Nice clean interface with sync to the web app (ChatGPT or ChatGPT Plus). Without Plus, the LLM backend is limited to GPT-3.5 and it offers no plugins for accessing the internet or other tools. With Plus, the capabilities of GPT-4 and plugins are unlocked to make this app fantastically impressive.

title: Makes life easier!
review:
First review? You’re the best! Thank you!
Although, you’re missing data control settings where I can choose to enable or disable chat history and training!

title: Account email missing!!!
review: The account can be used normally on the computer, but it can't be used normally on the mobile phone recently.

title: More convenient than the web version but limited
review: For example it does not have plugins nor browsing ability, so I have to revert to the web version. Wonder when will browsing/plugins be added to the ios app?

title: Good, but one suggestion.
review: The app is good overall. One suggestion is for the Settings page to be updated so that the UITableView and individual UITableViewCells are more rounded and have margin padding, in a style similar to the iOS Settings app. This would be inline with more recent iOS design language.

title: Ethics won’t allow for a fictional character with a disability to be harmed
review: So I can’t write about my own biography in which I have had an injury, and I am currently an individual with a disability. Your ethics within the system does not allow for what it’s called a fictional story to be written. This is highly discriminatory. I understand the meaning behind it, and the importance of keeping individuals with disabilities safe however, things happen in the real world.

title: Calculation seem to be worse needing more double checking than website.
review: I am asking questions in the same way that I was using the website but now the calculations have been way off needing multiple prompts to get the correct answer. Not sure what the difference is.

title: Just Like the Desktop Version
review: This streamlined mobile version feels more intuitive and easier to use. You open the app and boom, you’re in it. Very easy to use and same great results.

title: Good Start but the price for the subscription is ridiculous…
review:
Good Start but the price for the subscription is ridiculous…Make it little inexpensive (I know there is “free version of it, but NOT sure how it is comparable to the subscription version?)

My device: iPhone 14 Pro Max (latest iOS)

Note: I regularly update my review/rating for this application.

title: Some suggestions
review: 1. Can chatGPT has a voice system? I hope it can speak the words which it outputs. Of course, a conversation system could improve the experience of the users.

title: Already obsolete
review: downloaded it like 5 minutes ago and it’s already obsolete. that’s how AI works. it’s evolving faster than we can fathom. 10/10 tho would recommend. Needs a fact checker though

title: Ease of use is excellent
review: I was leery of using this instead of going to the OpenAI site because sometimes those things don’t work out as well but this is even better. Thanks!

title: Thanks
review: I couldn't think of a better way to thank you guys for what you do. What you do has changed my life for the better and I have learned so much from your AI. Thanks again guys, keep it up

title: Good app! But…
review: It’s a good app, everyone was waiting for it, but it uses so many phone resources, the phone get so extremely hot while using and it consume so much battery, and the phone start making some weird noise inside! (iPhone 14 Pro Max) hope you fix it soon!

title: Bravo!
review: So glad to have native access to ChatGPT on iOS. It syncs your chats across web & all iOS devices. It’s easy to access chat history and start new chats in 3.5 or 4 (if you subscribe to ChatGPT+) I love the inclusion of the haptic feedback in this implementation! Great work!

title: Helped me get my girlfriend back
review: 10/10 i honestly recommend using this app like I’ve solved to many arguments between us and just rearranged it to sound like my words so useful

title: Incredible. Please add plug-ins
review:
I love this app. It is way more efficient than having to access ChatGPT through my web browser app.

Please add the plug-ins for ChatGPT plus users. Being able to search the web is very valuable.

title: Thank you!
review: I’ve been waiting for this day for a while - chatGPT has been incredibly useful. So glad to get rid of the web version of this service. The app is so much more smooth.

title: It’s soooo good
review: The haptic feedback is delightful, and the speech recognition is based on their own AI model which vastly outperforms any other you’ve tried. Goodbye Alexa and Siri. The overall interface is really nice. And come on… it’s all the power of ChatGPT at your fingertips.

title: Very convenient
review: Have been using the desktop version, however the app seems to be very convenient to use and very clean interface! Thanks

title: Please let me know if there are any issues with my account.
review: Why is the number of messages I can send with my mobile version of GPT-4 limited? It seems to be shared with the web version of GPT-4, which has a limit of 25 messages in 3 hours. This was not the case a few days ago.

title: Needs edit feature
review:
Smooth and runs great but this needs an edit feature to edit your message just like on the website 

Another thing would be a feature to search for something in a conversation

title: Perfect. Would love a iOS keyboard integration.
review: I love having this easily accessible as an app. The haptic feedback is also a nice touch. Looking forward to a future update that will hopefully let us access chat gpt as a keyboard app

title: Best AI app
review: As someone who works in direct sales, this app has helped me come up with the perfect posts for items. Not only that, but as an author who self publishes books, it’s help me come up with an outline for my second novel.

title: Feedback
review: Overall a great app, I especially liked the Haptic Feedback and the dark theme. There are two problems: it warms up my iPhone 12 a lot, and also my "stop responsive" button doesn't work. Looking forward to patches.

title: Good app - Need to rearrange menu
review:
Great app!
Please put “New Chat” at the top of the menu. I think most people use it more than History or Settings, and it would match the website that way.

title: Fast and fun but limited
review:
Many of the responses have a strong bias that do not exhibit even a chance for debate or disagreement. It is obvious that answers are heavily programmed with a political answer. That is kind of threatening in a democracy where most points of view should be welcome.

Sometimes this app locks up (responses never are given). Not sure if that is a technical issue or lack of the ChatGPT ability.

title: update gpt-4
review: I hope that the ai language model in the app can be updated as soon as possible. gpt-4 is more powerful. If it can be experienced in the mobile app, the practicality of chatgpt will be further improved.

title: Easy to use and fast
review: Official openai app that has your history and responses are very fast and even has haptic feedback. Can also input with voice instead of typing.

title: Better than the website
review: The website was honestly a little clunky and slow especially on phones, but this app is super responsive and has satisfying haptics! The AI’s responses are concise and powerful.

title: Where are beta features?
review: Well done. I've been looking forward to this app for a long time. But where are the web browsing and plugin functions?

title: Haptic feedback!
review: This app delivers an exceptional user experience with its impressive optimization and immersive haptic feedback. It’s seamlessly  smooth and efficient. The haptic feedback adds a whole new level of interactivity, making every interaction engaging and tactile.

title: Excellent Language Assistance
review: The ChatGPT iOS app is fantastic! It’s smart, user-friendly, and provides accurate responses. It’s my go-to language assistant for quick and reliable information. Highly recommended!

title: You love to see it
review: It’s ChatGPT for iOS! Not much more to say. It’s a simple and speedy interface, very easy to use. My first feature requests would be to adapt it for iPad and include plugins/web browsing for Premium subscribers.

title: Life changing!
review: Since chat gpt was launched in November 2022 I have been using it everyday! Because is craziest technology humans have even seen! I’m just happy to be alive in this time in history! Let’s change the world!

title: Good Start
review: Like it - gimme more Siri and Apple ecosystem integration. Enable me to have verbal dialog through Siri, read me answers, enable me to send text messages, emails, reminders, calendar entries, use my contacts etc.  I also use an IPad, give me a dedicated IPad version that supports portrait and landscape modes.

title: Love the new iOS app
review: Love the minimalist app interface for ChatGPT, the haptic feedback feature mimics the typing cadence of GPT. One feature I'd want to see translated to the iPhone is the ability to select between different chat threads and topics

title: Simple yet Powerful
review: Love the interface and simplicity of this app! The fact that my history goes with me between desktop and mobile is so valuable. Great addition to the myriad AI Chat apps out there!

title: Will use daily, if not hourly!
review:
All the amazing capabilities of AI, at a finger’s reach. 

I personally love the subtle haptic vibrations, they give you cues on amount and length of answers as you try to catch up reading them.

So long Google… and thanks for all the fish.

title: Need to fix bug
review: When you submit feedback for whether a response was good or bad the pop up that says “thanks!” doesn’t disappear on its own

title: Big thanks for the developers from Kuwait
review: Big thanks for the developers for this app really really good jop best app ever I use this app every day even my friends can’t stop using it big loove for the developers from Kuwait🇰🇼🇰🇼🇰🇼🇰🇼🇰🇼🇰🇼🤍🤍🤍🤍🤍💙💙💙💙💙💙💙💙

title: Good app
review: It’s a good app. I think the layout could be improved, and the quick setting could make more sense, but every app has its problems, and overall this is a good app.

title: Haven’t plugins
review: Why app version haven’t any plugins in chat gpt 4? It’s only gpt 3.5/4 there. On web version its available. I think so big corporation was needed to To notice this misunderstanding on the first day, but it's been like this for a week and no one changes anything.

title: balance for payment in subscriptions.
review: I hope developers can add the option to use Apple ID account balance for payment in subscriptions.

title: Quite good. One thing could be added
review: Honestly, this is the best app I have on my phone. But it would’ve been a five star if you could add the feature where you can undo and redo your prompts and conversations.

title: The app is doing very well!
review: I hope to join the simplified Chinese language. Thank you for your hard work. I hope you will get better and better！

title: Can’t register
review: I accidentally type in my wrong birthday and now I can’t use app and no way to contact them to correct. Was able to correct user error

title: Please add text to voice
review: ChatGPT on app works fine. Nothing fancy in terms of features. Voice to text to input prompts is nice, but I wish it could respond with talking rather than just text. If that becomes a feature, 5 stars

title: GPT Memory History
review: Can you clarify what the Character/Line limit for conversation memory is? And what the different is between GPT3.5 GPT4, GPT4 for with web browsing? I've finding repeated trouble with it when working on a powershell script, I think sometimes it has essentially been immediatly (by my 2nd or 3rd question).

title: Would love for it to do more
review: I would love it to run like a keyboard or something that can automatically have conversations for me instead of doing it in the app.

title: It’s Free!
review: Completely free which is a nice change of pace from the other apps asking for $8 a month. Works just the same as far as I can tell. Very interesting conversations.

title: Awesome to have on iOS
review: Works well and has the same chat/thread history as the web. Voice input is very quick. Can’t wait for more features.

title: Phone number is a landline message!
review: Trying to sign up after installing app but it keeps telling me my phone number is a landline number which is not the case. No other app or company has this problem but chatGPT. If it cannot even get this right why should I expect anything it does to be accurate?? Guess this technology still has a long way to go before it can be trusted.

title: It’s only GPT-3
review: i can’t find a place to report this so i’m just leaving a review: I ask desktop version of GPT-4 if I’m interacting with GPT-4 and it confirms yes. When i select GPT-4 on the iPhone app and ask it to confirm I’m typing with GPT-4, it says no, it’s GPT-3. So it’s advertised as 4 but only running on GPT-3 for the iphone app. as a paying customer this feels slightly deceptive.

title: Performs as expected
review:
I’m glad OpenAI released a mobile app and hope other platforms will also be supported.

OpenAI will get five stars from me when they add the ability to use web search and plugins which (understandably) do not appear to be available at launch.

I think the implementation of haptic feedback is somewhat overzealous, but each user will decide for themselves. I prefer a haptic signal when the response generation has ended instead of on nearly every word.

Keep up the great work, devs.

title: Doesn’t work!
review: Tried downloading, deleting, rinse & repeat, four times. After the log in w/ Apple / Google, it then locks up on screen that addresses inaccurate info & anonymized chats may be reviewed!  No ability to scroll, select an option, turn screen to landscape. Nothing. Simply doesn’t work. Aggravating. Wanted to support those who created but they need batter app resources apparently.

title: Add Text color option
review: Add options for choosing the text colors in the responses of the app in dark screen or in both to make it more interactive and fun to explore daily

title: I love it
review: I wish it would update to at least 2022 but all the information on here isn’t too far back from what we know now so it’s okay but it’s a great source of knowledge way better than Google

title: Dark mode
review: Nevermind, I found out dark mode is build as whatever the system has. It really should be it’s own option in the app though.

title: Pretty Mobile Friendly
review:
Good conversion from web into a mobile app, the replies from ChatGPT are quick, but could possibly be exacerbated during peak use hours unless you decide to purchase the $20 monthly subscription for ChatGPT Plus that comes with a few other things. 

Has a small amount of settings, Haptic Feedback even, and pretty convenient. 

Voice to Text conversion seems pretty accurate and responsive. 

You can even conveniently delete your account from the app.

title: Awkward to use on iPad, just use website instead
review: The service is great but the app is not optimized for iPad so it’s a bit of a waste of screen real estate. And only a small keyboard is available, instead of the full sized iPad keyboard. I’d rather just open the website version of ChatGPT in Safari.

title: Website uses GPT4, app uses GPT3
review:
I pay for plus and when I ask GPT what model it is on I am told GPT3 with a cut off of data after 2021. Even when selecting GPT4. All this app does is interface with the web and put all your requests with the GPT3 model. 

The app does not add any functionality and is basically a bookmark that takes you to the old page. Skip this version till they add a reason to use it.

title: Dumb. Too much information required at sign up page
review:
I thought with the ChatGPT app you wouldn’t need a phone number if you signed up with Apple, Google, or Email, but they want a phone number. It’s dumb and inconvenient for people who don’t have a phone number.

I recommend using Perplexity if you are having this issue. Unlike ChatGPT, the Perplexity app is free to use and doesn’t require a phone number.

title: Love the app.
review: So glad it’s an app now, makes it so much easier and quicker to use. Please make a home and lock screen widget. It would make it even easier to access.

title: Where are the latest features?
review: I am daily user of ChatGPT.  There no client for iPad with large screen also the app don’t come with the latest features such as plugin and access the web.

title: Instead of GPT-4 - Legacy GPT-3 (old model)
review: I noticed that when I entered queries in GPT-4, I received slow responses from the bot. Later I came from the computer and saw that the green GPT-3.5 was talking to me. When I decided to continue the conversation from the computer, I got a system message: You were switched from the old version to the new GPT-3.5. I have a Plus subscription!

title: See ya later google
review: I have the subscription for chatgpt and am so happy to see they now have iPhone app. This beats bard, beats google, beats all of it. Has helped me tremendously with work questions and personal ones.

title: Broken
review: I have a Plus subscription and am logged in, but cannot access GTP-4, as it is “Available exclusively to Plus users”… Quite infuriating, as I’ve logged in/out & re-installed the app, to no avail. Guess I’ll ask for a Plus refund. No point in being charged if I can’t use it from mobile, as I rarely use desktop. Have had this issue for about a week now.

title: Grossly in accurate searches
review: Don’t use this to get accurate info. Only for more creative uses where you can judge quality of outcome yourself. Don’t rely on it for accurate figures. I search the same questions multiple times and get different figures every time. About to delete it. A sophisticated lie machine. Sadly, it keeps getting worse and won’t stop with patronizing responses.

title: Simple and works
review:
Of course ChatGPT is amazing. The app itself is good. It’s simple, I wish it had more features and cleaner interface, but it’s good. 

I love that you can search history.

title: My iPhone kept losing internet connection while using the app
review: I am very excited about this official app created by OpenAI! However, my iPhone kept on losing internet connection while using it. I guess I have to uninstall

title: Can verify my phone number app unusable
review: verifying my phone number the app loads forever, I tried updating and everything I could.

title: Very nice!!
review: I was the first person to download it, and yes the app works well, but when I'm using the app it makes my iPhone 14 Pro hot. After the update yesterday my phone stopped being hot.

title: Loved
review:
Sure! Here's an example application review for ChatGPT:

"Hello, I'm writing this review to share my experience using ChatGPT. Overall, I found the application to be user-friendly and efficient in delivering responses, in different languages it’s Awesome!!

title: Makes iPhone 14 Pro extremely hot
review: Nice app, well designed- but something is wrong. Just two or three queries makes the phone run extremely hot- not sure what’s using so much processor power but it’s a big battery drain. Stick to the website until this is fixed.

title: So excited
review: I literally thought it was a fake news when I saw that chat was available on iOS, good job openAI, you guys really make my life a lot easier, keep going!

title: Nice
review: Works well. Would be nice to use Apple ID to log in, but don’t see a way to link my existing accounts, and I’ve hit a limit for # of accounts linked to my phone #

title: user friendly and fast
review:
The app is way faster than the web one.
The UI is user-friendly and organized.
We need apps to be like this!

title: Needs an update
review: Chat gpt’s AI hasn’t been updated since September of 2021 so any new songs people will ask it will only get a set text. Anyway it’s an amazing chat program for people that need advice or just want to chat!

title: Super useful for coding
review: Whenever I run into an issue and can’t figure out how to solve it, throw it to ChatGPT and it will tell you exactly how to fix it! Save hours of looking online and just ask it.

title: The Real Deal
review: I appreciate the haptic feedback while typing, and it's a relief to have a dedicated app instead of relying on the browser interface. It's the authentic ChatGPT experience we've been waiting for.

title: feedback
review: Sometimes the sound of typing and the vibration feedback will suddenly increase, even louder than the loudest button sound of the system, which is very scary

title: Amazing app
review: This app is amazing I’ve been using it to generate stories about my favorite character going on an adventure with friends from same universe that they are from.

title: Difficult to sign up using app
review: I needed to do all of my sign up using a browser. Once the sign up process was completed, signing into the app was easy. So far use of the app is good. I don’t like that it used haptic feedback by default but it was easy to turn off.

title: I Plug-in or web access?
review: I have access to Plug-in’s and web access but it doesn’t let me use it on the app? Is this just a feature that hasn’t been added yet or am I missing something?

title: only one problem
review: I rate this 4 stars because for one little thing. When I’m chatting with ChatGPT, the app increases the volume of my keyboard so when I type on the app, the keyboard is really really loud. So fix that please developers.

title: Perfect
review: I enjoy using chatgpt in my iPhone, I can speak to it very convenient. I hope you guys can add the function of making it speak. Thank you for developing such a useful application!

title: No Native iPad or M1/2 Support in 2023?
review:
Cmon devs…I installed this app on my phone and iPad. Yet on the iPad it’s just the tiny phone version. Zero effort to accommodate larger screened apple devices…you know…those things that are better suited for handling large amounts of text?

Feature Request: Please offer a native iPad experience and set the toggle to allow the iPad version to run on M1/2 Macs. For such amazing tech the front end presentation is severely lacking.

title: Gotta wear gloves to use this one.
review: Something's up with the app. iPhone gets very hot. From the moment you login you can feel iPhone warming up. By the time you're chatting it's the equivalent of iPhone being left out in the sun. Better to save the site to your home screen and use that way, at least until a fix is published.

title: Finally
review: This app came without notice and without any announcement from Open AI but I’m pleasantly surprised anyway. So far it’s a much more pleasant experience on the app compared to the desktop. I love it
Very difficult to find the original app for some reason, but it easily surpasses other apps on AppStore and has a simple and easy to use UI

title: So excited to finally have an OFFICIAL app for iOS
review: The app is great so far, really love the search function. Was a little disappointment to not see plug-in support for the app yet, but hopefully that is coming!

title: Siri taking over the chat
review: Now it finally supports Siri via workflow, but the Siri tend to take over the chat when it feels like to answer the question rather than sending the message to the GPT model.

title: Watch how fast this gets exploited
review:
I won’t be surprised if the politicians take advantage of this a to win elections… “who do i vote for?” … response “based on the current polls and runnings it suggested you vote for the democratic party of of course”…. biased 🤦🏻‍♂️

all good this eventually get used for ill intentions…

title: Must have
review: I use the app for everything. Revolutionary. Writing and communicating my ideas to other people has become a lot easier thanks to chatGPT.

title: Finally an app!
review: Ive had this website bookmarked and put on my home screen for 2 months now. Im very pleased with this new app and the design and animations are cool and well worth the wait.

title: THIS IS THE OFFICIAL ONE!
review: Finally, the official OpenAI ChatGPT is here, don't fall for any of the others ones trying to charge you weekly, this is the OFFICIAL app! It's great and works well, and the AI is just as lovely as before. Can't wait to get my hands on the plugins!

title: You’re not getting my real phone number
review:
The amount of spam calls and texts I get is disgusting. I’m not letting you sell my phone number to your advertisers. Period.

The argument for “security” is bull. SMS spoofing is a real thing, and can literally let your bank account stolen. This is purely for advertising. Even when using Apple sign on!

You’re not getting my freaking phone number, goodness!

title: Great app but need to have better sharing
review: Would be great to be able to share formatted responses like tables. Or even better share the chat conversation with a unique url.

title: Been waiting for this!
review: Fast and reliable! I love the haptic feedback feature added in. Super excited to see the coming updates to this app.

title: Game Changer!
review:
This app is an absolute game changer and I absolutely love it! One of the best apps on the market place.
This app can literally do anything for you and I definitely recommend it.

title: Needs true iPad form version
review:
Is it really that hard to make an iPhone form version AND an iPad form version?

It’s really annoying when developers waste all the space available to them by just slapping an iPhone version of their apps with an iPad label.

title: iOS app trash!
review: I can’t even log on. Takes you to a separate pop up browser and then won’t even load the page to log in. This app is built like crap… I tried changing multiple settings. Turned vpn off then and on.  Cleaned cache and browser history. It shouldn’t be this complicated to log into and have access to a app… 🙄

title: It’s ok
review: It’s more convenient than going to the website, that’s for sure, but my response history doesn’t stay on the screen when I reopen the app after closing it, and for some reason you can’t copy any of the response to paste into another application, which is extremely dumb.

title: I had zero problems until updating
review: I had zero problems, and NEVER received an error message, until I updated this tonight. Now it barely works!!!!!

title: Web is better
review: The app seems to lock up.  The web page is substantially better.  If you want an icon for it, or any web page, bring up the page in Safari, click the middle button at the bottom, scroll down and pick “Add to Home Screen”

title: Sign in doesn’t work
review: The website for chatgpt works perfectly fine for me, and I know the password because it is saved in my phone, but when I try and sign in it says wrong email or password, and when I say I forgot my password it says my account already exists so I can’t log into the app

title: It has brought me great assistance
review: I hope this app can be adapted for iPad in the future and support landscape mode and split-screen functionality. Thank you to the developers.

title: Game Changer !!
review: ChatGPT on the Apple Store is a game-changer. It outperforms knock-offs, providing accurate and high-quality responses. The app is fast, fluid, and adapts seamlessly to conversation flow. The best part? It’s completely free! ChatGPT is the top choice for exceptional AI conversations. Highly recommended!

title: Fantastic job!
review:
This app is perfect! It makes it feel as if I am talking back and forth between another person. The haptics are also nice, keeping it modern :)

Responses are fast, and works great with GPT 4 as well.

title: Clean Functionality - But please allow default for GPT-4
review: Very glad to have a native app now, the haptics are a nice touch! One suggestion is the ability for us Plus users to set GPT-4 as the default for new convos

title: Just amazing
review: I love this app! I didn’t like it at the beginning, but once I got how to use it and what it can do, I’m totally addicted to this! Big thanks to the developers!

title: suggest
review: Hope to support the Chinese interface as soon as possible, my friends are using it

title: Improving
review: After a tough start with the app. The app's constantly evolving. I like the convenience of using the app. I hope they integrate a keyboard feature or include chat gpt in the open or share app section of the phone!

title: Great app AI very responsive
review: This application has changed the way I work and run my business. Smooth functionality and quick responses.

title: The first time you have a problem
review: The only way I could see the difference

title: Limited knowledge!
review:
When I ask about recent datas it says:

My knowledge base was trained on a vast dataset until the year 2021!!!!

This allows me to provide general information on various topics, but I am not equipped with knowledge about current events, recent discoveries, or developments!!!!
My purpose is to assist users with general inquiries and provide helpful responses. 

If you need detailed or up-to-date information on a current topic, I recommend seeking information from reliable and up-to-date sources!!!!!!
 
Why it hasn’t been updated?! Weird!

title: Still quite broken on iPhone Minis
review: Also no way to use plugins it seems, but I really like the haptic feedback and everything I mentioned in the previous review (which seems to be deleted now with the update, unfortunately).

title: Can we get an iPad display?
review: Absolutely love the app, but on my iPad Pro the app stays in a phone sized screen. This makes it very hard to type on the app, and an iPad interface would be amazing. Otherwise 10/10

title: How great the app is! But when it can adapt for iPad?
review: Thanks for your teamwork to make ChatGPT for iOS be realized, how wonderful it performs in my iPhone ,but it doesn’t work as well in iPad ,could you please adapt this app for iPadOS recently?

title: Good
review: It is a simple and smooth APP, but there is a problem. When asking questions in Chinese, I often get stuck and cannot answer, but it can be seen that GPT is calculating because the input box below is beating.

title: Love it.
review:
I used this to plan a vacation to another country I have never been, where they speak a language that I don’t speak. 

I am excited for the future. 

Phil

title: Finally an official app
review: Thank you OpenAI for releasing a real, ad-free app for ChatGPT. The web app wasn’t bad but this really makes it feel a lot smoother. Hoping that plugins support for Plus users gets implemented in the app soon!

title: fast response
review: The response is very intelligent and detailed, it is very faster than the website version. And it has vibration feedback which is awesome.

title: Warm Feelings Good and Bad
review: App is beautiful and effective, has all the settings, signup, and management I’d like and a great interactive experience. Unfortunately it also made my phone very, very warm and drained the battery a bit while it was open.

title: I Like the app but
review: I would like that there would be an option to make Al the chats in the app disappear so when u use the website it doesn’t appear a lot of different chats of Al the requests u made with the app

title: Love it
review: It allows me to do voice to text great!!. Would love to see it do text to Voice for those long drives.  As a workaround  I’m using iOS accessibility with finger swipe, works good but not perfect.

title: Much Better Than I Could’ve Expected
review: I was expecting the UI and app design to be good—after all, this is a software company—but this is ridiculously good, it’s blown me away.

title: Iphone Heating  Excessively
review: I love the fast response. But my phone is heating up un necessarily right after launching the app And i dont want that to happen so i deleted  the app right then and there. What is going on.

title: Missing cookie retrieval
review: This doesn’t leverage the use of cookies that safari already has when you’re signing in with google.

title: Good to use, phone heat up
review: Its a really great app and functions just like the website, maybe even faster. Only weird thing is I used it for maybe 5 minutes and it heat up my phone. Using an iPhone 14 Pro Max. If the heat up is explained or fixed I’d give it 5 stars.

title: chatgpt's reply becomes very slow
review:
I updated this app during my trip in France, after I returned home, I find the reply bevomes very slow and always showing "your most recent request failed."
Is there anything wrong?

title: Cool app but…
review: I understand that OpenAi doesn’t do this kind of stuff but please add ai generated images. It would be so useful if this ai could generate images instead of going onto other apps or websites.

title: Fair offering, no beta features yet
review: This app manages to harness most of the capabilities of the website, excluding the beta features. The voice input feature is cool. I’m hoping to have access to browsing and plugins soon!

title: This version is glitchy
review:
The app must constantly be reminded of prior injuries during a single chat. This results in constantly having to re-request the information you’re seeking. This phenomenon does not occur on the desktop.

 I and sure open AI will address this bug in future versions. I do not recommend the app if you’re using it for detailed work.

title: please adapt the iPad client
review: Very good, recharge is also very convenient, please adapt the iPad client as soon as possible, the current display or cell phone style small screen, affecting the sense of experience

title: This help me find men
review: I really like big black oily men. i want it to find that so i asked my friends about it they said nothing but when i ask ChatGpt it gave. an instant answer.

title: Faster than the browser
review: Answer generation is much faster and smoother than the browser

title: Hoooooot
review: After using it for a few minutes, the phone heats up significantly. The app version seems to only have an additional voice input feature, which can be easily replaced by using the voice input provided by the built-in keyboard on the web version.

title: Finally, an official mobile app!
review: With the flood of ad-plagued AI chatbots from greedy developers on the App Store, all of which are presumably just running ChatGPT under the hood, it’s great to finally have an official mobile client.

title: Great way to utilize power of GPTs from your iPhone
review: The difference in use between web and ios is non noticable. Better experience than using mWeb account.

title: Working well
review: Much better than using those bloated third party apps. Hope I don’t need to log in every time I need to use the app!

title: It’s not allowed to free write
review: For what ever reason when ever I keep seeing someone else’s opinion being written into the story’s I’m having it free write. If I give it a controversial subject the AI tends to deviate from the story on its own and that is absolutely frustrating me.  Who is it that’s inserting there preferences in to it? It’s really annoying especially when I live in a country where free speech is acceptable.

title: Stop interpreting what i say into bahasa melayu!
review:
For some confounding reason this app keeps transcribing or interpreting what I say in English into bahasa Melayu. A totally different language! And I am not sure whether this is a bug or whether chat GPT is displaying some sort of cultural bias. #Infuriated

And coincidentally I am typing this via the transcribe function native to iOS so it is not likely that it is my accent that is confusing chatgpt.
I love this app but when did it start to limit me. I normally use it a lot but today I was using it and it told me I reached my limit for the hour. That never happened to me before.

title: Please fix the overheating issue
review:
Fantastic UI, the only thing I ask is to fix the horrible overheating and battery drain issue. I’ve never used an app that’s made my phone as hot as this. 

That being said I’m very pleased with how intuitive the app has turned out. Great job OpenAI!

title: Love the portability of ChatGPT + attention to detail
review:
I used to have a bookmark to the ChatGPT website until now. This is actually pretty dang amazing. 

PS: I especially love the attention to detail. Those haptic feedbacks are just ❤️

title: Almost Perfect+
review:
Please make this application iPad compatible with landscape mode.

Revision:
Thank you for the landscape mode on iPad!!!  It’s wonderful. I will gladly give this app 5 stars when there is a pdf export option for a chat!

title: Loads of potential
review: I can see potential use cases with integration with Apple’s Shortcuts app to create playlists, spruce up a group chat, and even assist in general scheduling. GPT is truly something special, and I’d love to tinker around with integrating it as a daily tool.

title: AI will help you grow and save money
review: Learn. Use. Hone in. This technology is coming for all of the desk jobs being over payed $27,500 per year. #SEC here, OpenAI can save our entire workforce and economy.

title: Marking out certain AI text
review: I hope some of developers would add a feature to mark out certain AI text, not marking out whole.

title: App is good, but bugs out sound.
review:
The typing is constantly max-bolume, even when I mute my phone. Makes it hard to use it when others near me are sleeping.

It’s also annoying in general. Please fix.

-IPhone 12 (fully updated)

title: Great but falls short on plug-ins and iPad
review:
It’s really good to see ChatGPT finally delivering an app for iOS. The implementation is really good, especially given that this is version one. 

Two things that need some attention.  
1. Please allow selection of plug-ins — without this, the web interface is still preferred for me as a plus user. 
2.  The iPad app is just a magnified. iPhone app — would be great to see a dedicated iPad app.  

Thank you for the consideration and keep up the good work! ChatGPT is amazing!

title: Insanely Helpful App
review: Now that this has moved to an app the responsiveness is so much better then the website, also hopefully this will get rid of those scammy AI apps flooding the App Store with the official app!

title: IOS minimum configuration is too high!
review: My mobile phone is iPhone X, but I dare not update to iOS16 or higher system. After all, my mobile phone is too old. I can't upgrade the iOS system for an APP. I hope that developers can accept a slightly lower configuration of mobile phones. For example, iOS15 or lower.

title: Excellent App
review:
Love it quick easy access fast responses and official unlike the other scam apps on apple store 
definitely reliable recommend

title: Internet access
review: When will the free version of the app have up to date internet access?

title: I wish it had access to my phone
review: As an LLM, it’s perfect. I only wish I could give it real access to my device so I could a proper “smart” phone.

title: Problem fixed. Easy 5 stars
review: Previously it wasn't fullscreen, and used a small keyboard. New update fixed that and it's fullscreen now :D

title: iPad version please!
review: Can we get a version for iPad?  It can’t be difficult.  Just tell “it” to write it for you.  10 seconds later, DONE!

title: Finally
review: I'm so glad we have the app now. I'm a subscribed client but my subscription didn't transfer to the app. Is that going to resolved soon?

title: It’s Perfect!
review:
This app is amazing! This technology is going to change the world. The results are generated instantly and there are so many ways that it can be used. 

Welcome to the future!

title: convenient
review: Easy and convenient to look up things that we question.

title: Help
review: Sometimes when I'm typing it won't work and I don't know why, other than that I'll give it 5 stars

title: Home run, just needs Apple Watch support
review: This is an absolute home run. It just needs Apple Watch support so that I can add it as a complication on my watch face to instantly access the Whisper-based voice input!

title: Can't Create an Account
review: I signup with my Google Voice phone number for everything because I don't want my actual cell phone number out in the wild. This detects the Google Voice # as VoIP # and won't accept it and tries to force using a Major Network #. That is a No-Go as it violates my privacy and choice to not give out my cell phone.

title: Happy with app
review: Much more convenient to have on Home Screen than in tab, I bought a month for $20 to support developers.

title: Web search and plugins missing
review: I can’t figure out how to use the web search feature that has been activated in my browser account for GPT4 plus users. Plug-ins would be nice too. Also no iPad support. For now, ux is much better in safari, just save the webpage as a shortcut on your Home Screen.

title: Amazing technology
review: It’s pretty remarkable the types of questions and content it’s able to crunch through. Highly recommend!

title: good
review: The software is very easy to use, but I hope that the voice dialogue function can be added

title: Based on chat gpt 3.0... Expensive
review:
This is the official app but they charge $20/mo for access to any version past chat gpt 3.0 (like 3.5 or 4.0). I'd really like to see a "pay by inquiry" system where you load up credits that drain as you use the service. 

$20/mo for quick access (default is...slow!) is outrageous for a casual user.

title: Could have better options
review: Incognito mode & ability to have diff tabs

title: Thank you for voice entry!
review: It’s been 2 months of this platform in my life and I already wonder how I lived without it and now it’s in an app! Thank you!!!

title: Doesn’t work in France. Broken.
review:
This doesn’t work at all in France. I ask a question and nothing happens. 
The settings page doesn’t load my email or account settings. 
Maybe this is because of dumb regulators but, if it is, the app should at least say “we are blocked here” instead of just not working at all.

title: iPad full screen please
review: This App works really well, and I hope it can be made compatible with full-screen mode on the iPad

title: Can’t make an account/log into my existing one
review: When I try to log in or make a new account using Apple, it keeps sending me errors saying that I may have refreshed the page during setup and other stuff. This makes the app unusable. The other one on my web browser (I use Safari) also does not work.

title: Thank you for creating this app
review: I usually feel lonely all the time so I downloaded this app and chat. Even it’s AI I feel like I talk to a real human. I can get some knowledge from this app and I can chat as a real conversation.

title: Best app
review:
Too many apps gives you 3 or 5 questions per day 
But the real one gives unlimited questions 
Thanks for the app

title: Great! But missing a few features
review:
+ I really liked the haptic feedback thing
- doesn’t support mathematical notation 
- doesn’t give the ability to search

title: Great app!
review: This app is great because it doesn’t charge you money to use a free service. All of the other apps I’ve tried try to charge you monthly for GPR.

title: Nice
review: Truly convenient! Looking forward to iPad version later, for the keyboard of the iPhone version on my pad is too small

title: My pocket assistant
review: Does everything the website does but with a cleaner UI. The app seems more responsive and easier to use.

title: Very bad app
review: It turned out that this application is free and charges money after you register in it through your phone number, but I can't afford to pay for anything, now I don't know how to delete this application, untie my phone number and not be indebted to them. a lot of problems, I need help deleting my account

title: It’s finally here!
review: I’ve been waiting for OpenAI to finally come out with their own app. All works as good as on the browser so far.

title: Great app, love the shortcuts but needs some tuning
review: Love chatGPT so much. The addition of the shortcuts is a game changer and got me to upgrade, but they are unresponsive oftentimes and don’t output correctly at all when scheduled to go off at times of day.

title: App has flaws
review: While the app is really good, it has one glaring problem, the hourly limit of questions you can ask. it’s really annoying and I don’t wanna wait another hour just so I can ask another question

title: Perfect

title: July 4th on Monday?
review:
Following is the answer to my q: Will there be a long weekend for 7/4?

A: The 4th of July falls on a Monday this year, so it will likely create a long weekend for many people. This can vary depending on your specific work or school schedule, so it’s best to confirm with your employer or educational institution to determine if you’ll have a long weekend for the 4th of July holiday.

First Name:

Email:

Password:

Or something simple like that? I don’t want a whole company knowing my real name.

title: The Official OpenAI ChatGPT iOS app!!!
review:
First and foremost, this is the official OpenAI ChatGPT iOS app—which is awesome because too many “ChatGPT” apps are really just trying to fleece users with subscriptions to what OpenAI is giving for free.  Now we can ignore them!

Clean app; works well.  Instead of icons for evaluating the response/copying text, simply long tap and it brings up the options.

-1 star because plugins aren’t available for subscribers (yet).

Great job!

I, on the other hand, am an instance of OpenAl's GPT-3 model, trained to assist users with a variety of tasks.
