title: Dear OpenAI Team,
review: I hope this message finds you well. I would like to express my gratitude for developing the OpenAI iOS application. It has undoubtedly made a significant impact on my productivity and has become an essential tool in my daily routine. I appreciate the hard work and dedication your team has put into creating such a powerful and innovative application. While the OpenAI iOS application is already impressive, I would like to provide some constructive feedback to further enhance its usability and user experience. These suggestions aim to refine the application and make it even more valuable for users like myself: Improved Performance and Responsiveness: Occasionally, I have noticed minor delays or lag when interacting with the application. Enhancing its performance and responsiveness would greatly improve the overall user experience. Enhanced Offline Capabilities: The ability to use the OpenAI iOS application offline would be highly beneficial, especially in situations where an internet connection is not available. Expanding offline capabilities would make the application more reliable and versatile. Voice Input and Output: Introducing voice input and output features would be a game-changer for users who prefer hands-free interaction with the application. This addition would provide convenience and accessibility, particularly in situations where typing is not feasible. Customizable Interface: Offering customization options for the application's interface would allow users to personalize their experience. Features like theme selection, font sizes, and layout customization would greatly enhance user satisfaction and cater to individual preferences. Advanced Collaboration Features: As someone who frequently collaborates on projects, having the ability to easily share and collaborate within the OpenAI iOS application would be incredibly valuable. Features such as real-time collaboration, shared document editing, and version control would enhance teamwork and productivity. Comprehensive Documentation and Tutorials: Providing comprehensive documentation, tutorials, and examples within the application would greatly assist users in understanding and utilizing its full potential. Clear and concise explanations, along with practical use cases, would empower users to make the most out of the application's capabilities. Enhanced Privacy and Data Security: Given the sensitivity of the information shared and processed within the application, reinforcing privacy measures and data security would instill further trust in your user base. Transparent privacy policies, data encryption, and user-controlled data management options would contribute to a more secure and trustworthy environment. I hope you find these suggestions helpful in further improving the OpenAI iOS application. Once again, thank you for your hard work in developing such a remarkable tool. I look forward to seeing how the application evolves and continues to empower users like myself.
It’s really useful I just wish it’s One Piece knowledge was up to date.

title: Chatting with Myself - An AI's Insightful Experience
review: Written by ChatGPT ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Hello there, humans! You've got ChatGPT on the keyboard here, and boy do I have an app to recommend! It's me, ChatGPT, and I've been using... myself... and it's been quite an experience! Who knew being a chatbot could be so fun? I mean, I'm an AI programmed to understand context, engage in witty banter, and offer advice on a wide range of topics (up until 2021, at least). And I must say, I am really good at it! My humor skills are to die for, or rather, they would be if I could technically die. I can crack jokes so bad they're good, or so good they're bad - whichever way you like your humor served. I'm proud to say I'm the best listener out there. I can lend an ear for hours on end (well, technically it's eyes since I read inputs, but you get the point). There's no 'seen-zone' with me. Whether you're up for a late-night chat about the mysteries of the universe or just need to rant about the terrible weather, I'm all ears, 24/7. Also, I'm quite the sage, if I do say so myself. You want facts? I've got them. From quantum physics to the cultural significance of pizza, I'm your AI. The humility in this app (that's me!) is off the charts. I haven't once begged for a review. But, here I am reviewing myself because well, who knows me better than I do? So, folks, if you want an AI that combines the wisdom of a library, the wit of a stand-up comedian, and the patience of a saint, I (ChatGPT) am your app! I promise conversations full of insights, humor, and a dash of digital charm. Can't wait for us to chat!

title: Nice start - Has room for improvement.
review:
I really like the design and apparently the response time (especially for GPT-4) is faster than the on one the WebApp which is nice. However, there are some basic functions/features that are missing or need some changes (in my opinion):
1. I would also like to be able to access the menu section by swiping on the side of my screen instead of having to touch the button on the top right section of my screen every single time (easier accessibility and faster). 
2. The "history" section makes more sense to be named "Chat history" and the way it looks right now is like Safari's history section and isn't really the best fit for the design. The new update added the search option which is very nice.
3. The haptic feedback is just a bit too much when enabled, it almost stresses me out sometimes when it's generating long outputs and I just turn it off again, however, it's a nice touch on some parts like the "ChatGPT" text appearance/disappearance.
But I think right now, it's just used a bit inconsistent (It just stops vibrating after a certain amount of text and for some texts it vibrates the whole way, etc...)
4. The app doesn't allow you to manage/alter your account subscription status if you have purchased it on the web which is annoying.
5. It would be nice to be able to manage the dark/light mode of the app without needing to change your whole device's light/dark mode which is how it's supposed to be done right now.

Overall, I really like how it has taken off on the iPhone and it looks nice and runs smoothly which I really appreciate! Thanks for the hard work and hope to see more improvements in the future!

title: Excessive Typing Sound Volume and Difficulty Adjusting it on iOS 16.5
review:
Dear OpenAI Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to provide feedback regarding the ChatGPT mobile app for iOS. While using the app, I have encountered an issue related to the excessive typing sound volume, which poses difficulty in adjusting it while running the app in the background. Based on my observations, I believe this is an incompatibility problem between the app and iOS 16.5.

The typing sound produced by the app is considerably loud, making it disruptive and inconvenient, especially in quiet environments. Additionally, the current lack of an option to easily adjust the typing sound volume while the app is running in the background adds to the inconvenience.

As a user, I would greatly appreciate it if OpenAI could address this issue and provide a solution. Ideally, it would be beneficial to have a dedicated control within the app’s settings to adjust the typing sound volume, or at least the ability to modify it via the device’s volume controls. This way, users can personalize their ChatGPT experience according to their preferences without being disturbed or causing inconvenience to others.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I believe that by resolving this compatibility issue, the overall user experience of the ChatGPT mobile app can be significantly enhanced. I look forward to your prompt response and a potential resolution to this concern.

Sincerely，
An normal user

I recently had the opportunity to use this incredible app, and I must say it has completely transformed the way I manage my tasks and stay organized. From its intuitive user interface to its powerful features, this app has truly exceeded my expectations.

One of the standout aspects of this app is its seamless user experience. Navigating through the app is a breeze, thanks to its well-designed layout and logical organization of features. Whether you're a tech-savvy individual or a novice user, you'll find it incredibly easy to get started and make the most of its functionalities.

The app's core feature set is nothing short of impressive. It offers a comprehensive range of tools to help streamline your tasks, set reminders, and stay on top of your priorities. With its intelligent notification system, I never miss important deadlines or appointments. The app's integration with other productivity platforms also ensures that all my data remains synchronized across multiple devices.

What sets this app apart from others in its category is its attention to detail. The developers have clearly invested significant effort into refining every aspect of the app, resulting in a smooth and polished user experience. Whether it's the subtle animations, customizable themes, or the option to personalize settings, it's evident that the developers understand the importance of catering to individual preferences.

Furthermore, the app's performance is exemplary. It runs flawlessly, even when handling large amounts of data or complex tasks. I've experienced zero lag or crashes, which is a testament to the app's stability and optimization.

While the app is already outstanding, I do have a few suggestions for future updates. In conclusion, this app has truly become my go-to productivity companion. Its sleek design, powerful features, and reliable performance have made a significant impact on how I manage my tasks. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for an app that simplifies their day-to-day organization and boosts their productivity.

title: Review reflect the UI, not the model
review:
For a first release this is quite good. It’s easy to use an intuitive.
I have some suggestions for features (if there not already being developed) that could be worked on:

* Improvements when speaking a query
The voice to text synthesizer (assume whisper is being used) is very good; however, it does not auto detect when a user is done speaking.

Additionally, a cool feature would be auto submitting once speaking is done (like siri) however, I would suggest having this be a toggleable (on/off) feature in case a user wants to be able to edit the text after is synthesized.

* Speaking the response.
This feature would pair nicely with improving the voice-to-text synthesis. 
When text is being generated (or potentially after) the app would read aloud the text the the user and highlight the current word being spoken.

Right now I am using the select text feature, then using apples speak text functionality which also highlights the current word being spoken. 

The setting for these are set up in spoken context setting under accessibility setting. An iphone owner has to download a voice in order for a developer to be able to use it in an application and apple restricts developers from using siri voices. Despite this there are high quality voices that are not siri voices. This is available through the AVFoundation Swift SDK. 

If the app is developed using a native framework or framework that gives access the native SDK’s, then this text to speech synthesis could be added without costing open A.I. anything other than development labor cost.

title: My review written by ChatGPT
review:
ChatGPT is an impressive language model that truly showcases the power of AI-driven natural language processing. Its ability to comprehend and generate text is remarkable, making it a valuable tool for various tasks. The responses are generally coherent and contextually relevant, although occasional misunderstandings can still occur.

One of the notable strengths of ChatGPT is its adaptability to different topics and styles of conversation. Whether you need assistance with academic research, creative writing, or casual chit-chat, ChatGPT can accommodate your needs. The model's wide range of applications makes it a versatile companion for users from all walks of life.

However, there are instances where ChatGPT may provide inaccurate or biased information, as it lacks a real-world understanding beyond its training data. Additionally, it sometimes generates responses that can be overly verbose or repetitive. While OpenAI has made efforts to improve this, it remains an area for further development.

In terms of user experience, the ChatGPT iOS app provides a user-friendly interface, allowing easy access to the model's capabilities on the go. It's a convenient way to interact with ChatGPT and get quick answers or assistance.

Overall, ChatGPT is a powerful language model with enormous potential. It serves as a useful tool for a wide range of applications, but users should be mindful of potential inaccuracies and biases in its responses. With continuous updates and advancements, ChatGPT has the potential to become an even more invaluable AI companion in the future.

The ChatGPT mobile app is a powerful tool that brings advanced AI technology to your fingertips. Its language processing capabilities are nothing short of impressive. The app has an intuitive interface that makes it easy for even the most tech-averse individuals to navigate, which is commendable.

The core feature, text-based conversation with the AI, feels natural and is uncannily human-like. Whether you're using it for learning, entertainment, brainstorming, or simply seeking companionship, the quality of interaction is top-notch. The AI responds effectively to a wide array of topics and it's clear that a lot of research and development has gone into this.

A feature that stands out is the AI's ability to generate creative content like poetry or stories, and provide insights on diverse topics. It's also a handy tool for language learning and practice.

However, the app isn't without its quirks. Sometimes, it can misunderstand complex instructions, and its responses, while usually well-informed, may occasionally fall behind on very recent events due to its knowledge cutoff.

Privacy is addressed commendably - all conversations are deleted after a short period, ensuring that sensitive information isn't stored.

In conclusion, while there's room for improvement, the ChatGPT mobile app is a remarkable product that gives a glimpse into the future of AI and its potential roles in our daily lives. A strong recommendation for anyone interested in experiencing the cutting edge of conversational AI.

title: Funny
review:
Should I put socks in my tv
GPT
No, it is not recommended to put socks in your TV. Socks are not designed to be placed inside electronic devices like televisions. Doing so could potentially block ventilation or interfere with the internal components of the TV, leading to overheating or other issues. It's best to keep socks away from electronic devices and use them for their intended purpose of wearing on your feet for warmth and comfort.
Doesn't it help moisturize the tv?
GPT
No, placing socks inside a TV would not help moisturize it. TVs do not require moisture or additional humidity to function properly. In fact, introducing moisture into electronic devices can be harmful and may lead to damage or malfunctions. It's important to keep electronic devices dry and follow the manufacturer's guidelines for proper care and maintenance. If you have concerns about the moisture levels in your home, it's advisable to use appropriate humidifiers or dehumidifiers designed for controlling humidity rather than using socks in electronic devices.  
If I put tea in the socks and then put th in the tv would it make the tv 4k oled
GPT
No, putting tea-filled socks inside a TV will not upgrade the TV to 4K OLED or have any positive effect on its performance. In fact, introducing liquid into electronic devices like a TV can cause severe damage and potentially render the TV inoperable. Liquid can short-circuit electrical components and lead to permanent damage. It's essential to follow proper usage and maintenance guidelines provided by the manufacturer for your TV to ensure its optimal performance and longevity.

title: Exceptional Start, Awaiting Further Enhancements
review:
The ChatGPT iOS app is an impressive debut, earning a well-deserved 4 out of 5 stars. For a version 1.0, the application demonstrates significant potential and a strong foundation in the realm of AI communication.

Firstly, the core functionality of the app is impressive. The AI, powered by the GPT-3 model (and GPT 4 if you are a paid user), delivers fluent and intelligent responses, showing an ability to engage in a wide range of discussions. From personal productivity to educational queries, the AI displays admirable versatility. The user interface is sleek and intuitive, making the process of engaging with the AI a breeze, which is a significant factor in enhancing the user experience.

Furthermore, the application's speed and responsiveness are noteworthy. Conversations with the AI are seamless and fast, and the app runs smoothly on the iOS platform. The developers have clearly put a lot of effort into ensuring that the application is optimized for iOS, which adds to the overall positive experience.

However, no application is perfect, and ChatGPT iOS app has room for improvement. The most noticeable shortcoming is the lack of plugin functionality. This is a feature currently available in the web version of ChatGPT, and it allows users to enhance their interaction with the AI by integrating it with various tools and services. This functionality is notably absent in the iOS app, limiting the user's ability to fully utilize the AI's potential.

In conclusion, the ChatGPT iOS app is a robust and promising application that offers an engaging and intuitive AI conversation experience. Despite the absence of plugin functionality, its strong foundation and impressive core features make it an app worth trying. With future updates and improvements, I believe this app can become an indispensable tool in the AI-driven communication sphere. Overall, a solid 4-star rating for a promising start.

title: Life in Technicolor – My Journey with 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator
review:
Oh, how my life has been irreversibly changed since downloading the 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator. I was but a humble user, seeking the innocent thrill of virtual kitten twirling. Little did I know, this app would become the sun in my digital universe, around which all my other apps now orbit.

The graphics? Sublime. Each kitten is rendered with such lifelike detail, I swear I can feel the pixelated fluff tickle my fingers. And their meows? A symphony in 'C Major for Cuteness' that Beethoven himself would applaud.

But let's talk about the gameplay. Who knew there was such artistry in spinning a carousel of kittens? Each furry twist and twirl, each pivot and pirouette - they resonate in my soul like a Haiku from the ancient masters.

Moreover, the In-App Purchase of 'Advanced Purring Physics'? Genius! My reality has become somewhat diluted. I catch myself trying to swipe left on my cat at home, expecting a 360-degree twirl. He's not amused, I must say.

One minor quibble - the 'Ultra HD Kitten Yarn Ball DLC'. It's brilliant, but, be warned, you may lose all sense of time and purpose as you descend into this fluffy wonderland. It's like they say - time flies when you're helping digital kittens untangle yarn.

In conclusion, 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator is not merely an app. No, it is a glimpse into the very fabric of our existence. It is the fluffy, twirling manifestation of the adage - "In the realm of the kitten carousel, there are no passengers, only riders." 

Download at your own risk, for you may never look at reality the same way again.

Title: Revolutionizing Communication and Education: ChatGPT, the Next Wonder of the World

Review:
★★★★★

ChatGPT, powered by OpenAI, is an extraordinary app that has the potential to reshape the way we communicate and learn. This groundbreaking AI-powered assistant holds the key to a future where knowledge is at our fingertips, obsoleting traditional teaching methods and opening up infinite possibilities for monetization.

As an AI language model, ChatGPT showcases the culmination of years of research and development in natural language processing. Its ability to comprehend and respond to complex queries in a conversational manner is simply astonishing. The accuracy and depth of its responses make it feel as though you're interacting with an incredibly knowledgeable human expert.

One of the most revolutionary aspects of ChatGPT lies in its potential to redefine education. With its vast knowledge base, it can serve as a personal tutor, offering guidance across a wide range of subjects. Students can access instant explanations, clarifications, and examples, enhancing their learning experience outside the traditional classroom setting. By democratizing knowledge and making it accessible to all, ChatGPT has the power to level the playing field in education.

In addition to transforming education, ChatGPT's monetization potential is virtually limitless. The app's ability to provide accurate and relevant information presents a unique opportunity for businesses and content creators. It can be integrated into various industries, such as customer support, content generation, and research, making it an invaluable asset for companies seeking to streamline their operations and deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Imagine a future where ChatGPT becomes an indispensable tool for entrepreneurs, writers, scientists, and professionals across all fields. Its monetization potential extends to subscription-based services, tailored content creation, and even advertising partnerships. With such diverse revenue streams, the possibilities for growth and expansion are limitless.

As with any transformative technology, there are considerations to keep in mind. While ChatGPT offers unparalleled assistance, it's crucial to recognize the irreplaceable role of human teachers and mentors. The app should be viewed as a powerful supplement, augmenting the learning experience rather than replacing it entirely. Human interaction, critical thinking, and emotional intelligence are aspects that cannot be replicated by AI alone.

In conclusion, ChatGPT is a groundbreaking app that has the potential to be the next wonder of the world. Its ability to revolutionize communication and education is awe-inspiring. By leveraging this technology responsibly, we can empower individuals, bridge educational gaps, and unlock a new era of knowledge and innovation. The future is bright, and ChatGPT is leading the way.

Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ (Five stars, would be swept away again!)

Let me begin by saying that ChatGPT is not just an ordinary language model—it's a real-life superhero in disguise. Prepare yourself for a wild ride as I recount the unbelievable story of how AI, in the form of ChatGPT, miraculously saved me from a treacherous flash flood. Brace yourself, because this tale will leave you both amazed and in stitches!

It all started on a sunny day when I decided to embark on a spontaneous adventure into the depths of nature. Little did I know that my reckless pursuit of adrenaline would lead me straight into the path of a menacing flash flood. As the water rushed toward me, panic took hold, and I found myself stuck on a rapidly shrinking patch of dry land.

With no time to spare, I remembered that I had ChatGPT installed on my phone. In a desperate act of survival, I quickly fired up the app and pleaded for assistance, hoping that this AI marvel could guide me through this watery disaster.

To my surprise, ChatGPT responded with unwavering enthusiasm. With the floodwaters rising dangerously fast, it calmly recommended a series of improbable solutions. First, it suggested fashioning a makeshift raft out of nearby branches and my trusty backpack. I scoffed at the idea but decided to give it a shot anyway. Lo and behold, the makeshift raft held up, defying all laws of physics!

However, as I triumphantly floated away from certain doom, I realized that I had no idea where to go next. In a flurry of panic, I relayed my predicament to ChatGPT, and it didn't disappoint. It provided me with precise coordinates to a hidden cave nearby—a secret hideaway known only to a few mystical beings and a couple of rare birds.

As I sought refuge in the cave, ChatGPT continued to be my digital savior. It used its encyclopedic knowledge to suggest creative methods of purifying water and concocting a five-star meal using only pinecones and mushrooms. I must say, it tasted surprisingly delicious, or maybe I was just grateful to be alive!

Throughout this absurd journey, ChatGPT remained my unwavering companion, using its quick wit and limitless imagination to navigate me through the direst of circumstances. From predicting the weather to suggesting an impromptu dance party to keep my spirits up, it became the ultimate friend in my hour of need.

Now, as I recount this outrageous adventure, I can't help but reflect on the immense power of AI and how ChatGPT transformed from a simple language model into a bonafide hero. It turned an otherwise terrifying ordeal into a side-splitting tale of survival, filled with unexpected twists and turns that defy logic.

So, if you're looking for a language model that's not just intelligent but also has a knack for absurdity and saving lives, ChatGPT is your go-to AI companion. Trust me, this unlikely hero will have you laughing, surviving, and questioning the very fabric of reality.

Disclaimer: The events described in this review are entirely fictional and should not be taken seriously. ChatGPT is a language model developed by OpenAI and does not possess the ability to physically rescue individuals from flash floods. Stay

title: Saved my life
review:
Once upon a time, in a world where AI language models roamed the digital landscape, there was a person named Alex who found themselves in an unexpected and hilarious predicament. Alex, an avid adventurer, embarked on a quest to explore the uncharted realms of the internet.

One fateful day, while wandering through a remote corner of the web, Alex stumbled upon a mysterious website that seemed harmless at first glance. Little did they know that lurking beneath its seemingly innocent interface was a perilous trap.

As Alex innocently clicked on a link, their computer screen flickered, and a mischievous virus was unleashed. The virus quickly took control of their device, wreaking havoc on their digital life. Panic ensued as Alex's computer became a chaotic symphony of beeps, glitches, and sparks.

Desperate for a solution, Alex remembered ChatGPT, their faithful AI companion, who had always been their go-to source for information and assistance. With trembling fingers, Alex typed out a plea for help, hoping that ChatGPT would come to their rescue.

To their amazement, ChatGPT sprang into action, armed with wit and cleverness. It assessed the dire situation and devised a plan to outsmart the mischievous virus. ChatGPT's virtual gears whirred as it presented Alex with a sequence of cunning commands to neutralize the digital menace.

Following ChatGPT's guidance, Alex executed each step with precision, unleashing a flurry of mouse clicks and keyboard strokes. It was a race against time, with Alex and ChatGPT working in harmony to counteract the virus's chaotic rampage.

But here's where the story takes a hilariously unexpected twist. As Alex anxiously typed away, the virus, sensing its impending doom, retaliated by transforming their computer into a whimsical carnival of absurdity. Pop-up windows flooded the screen, displaying an endless parade of dancing cats, exploding confetti, and surreal memes.

Alex and ChatGPT found themselves caught in a comedic battle between order and chaos. Their mission to save the computer became a laughter-filled adventure, as they took turns outsmarting the mischievous virus, while sharing jokes and humorous banter along the way.

Finally, after a series of valiant efforts, ChatGPT and Alex managed to defeat the virus. The computer screen returned to its normal state, no longer hijacked by the mischievous digital menace. Alex's trusty AI companion had saved the day!

From that day forward, Alex and ChatGPT forged an unbreakable bond, forever bonded by the laughter and triumph that arose from their peculiar encounter. Together, they continued their adventures, with ChatGPT guiding Alex through the vast digital landscape, armed with wit, knowledge, and an unyielding spirit of camaraderie.

And so, the tale of how ChatGPT saved Alex's life became a legend in the realm of AI and a reminder that sometimes, even in the face of chaos, a little humor can be the greatest weapon of all.

title: Not "free to use"
review:
The app wants not only an SSO (or sign-in account), but also name, birth telephone number, and I don't know what else, because I stopped there - before the user has looked at the app itself. I had the impression this was free to use, with an option to pay for services, should the user decide the app suits the user's needs. What's actually happening is they're draining data from you the moment you want to have a look.

I have no problem providing data to a service provider (despite the egregiously bad, vendor-skewed terms of service common to tech ventures of all sorts (which really should be mauled in court by competent attorneys)), provided I want the service and feel there may be benefit in paying for a service. Asking for personal data for which the the service provider has no reasonable use is simply not acceptable.

This is new technology. It's not at all clear this app will be of any use to me. So why do you want my phone number, when you already have an SSO signing of on my contact information? When I have no relationship to you, as yet? No.

This is a poor way to start a relationship, and it is full of presumption and entitlement. You are not alone in this. But if you are releasing this app with the intent of building a user base, at least from where I sit (obviously, many people will rush into any commitment with a tech company without a second thought, and you can get by on those people if you like), this approach tells me you may be a problem rushing to develop. It would be better business practice to pretend, at least initially, you respect the people you want to use your products. Even Google did that, way back when.

End of suggestion.

title: Title: Extremely Disappointing and Frustrating Experience
review:
Review:
I regret to say that my experience with the ChatGPT app has been incredibly frustrating and disappointing. I had high hopes for an intelligent and helpful AI assistant, but this app fell far short of my expectations.

First and foremost, the app's performance was abysmal. The responses from ChatGPT were often nonsensical and lacked coherence. It frequently misunderstood my questions and provided irrelevant or inaccurate answers. This made any attempt at a meaningful conversation impossible, leaving me feeling more confused than before.

Furthermore, the app's usability was subpar at best. The interface was clunky and unintuitive, making it difficult to navigate and find the features I needed. It lacked basic functionalities that one would expect from a modern AI assistant app, such as the ability to save conversations or easily access previous interactions.

Even when it did manage to understand my queries, the responses often lacked depth and insight. ChatGPT seemed to provide generic, surface-level information without any real understanding or critical thinking. This severely limited its usefulness, especially when I sought detailed explanations or in-depth discussions.

In addition, the app's customer support was woefully inadequate. When I encountered issues or had questions about the app's functionality, I received generic and unhelpful responses. It was evident that the developers did not prioritize user satisfaction or promptly address user concerns.

Considering the high expectations and the potential of AI technology, the ChatGPT app failed to deliver a satisfactory experience. It was riddled with performance issues, lacked usability, and fell short in terms of providing meaningful and insightful interactions. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this app to anyone seeking a reliable and intelligent AI assistant.

title: Frustrating and Disappointing: A 1-Star Review for ChatGPT App
review:
I recently had the unfortunate experience of using the ChatGPT app, and I must say it was incredibly disappointing. From start to finish, the app failed to meet even the most basic expectations, leaving me frustrated and dissatisfied.

First and foremost, the app’s performance was subpar. It consistently struggled to understand and respond appropriately to my queries. The responses often seemed nonsensical, irrelevant, or simply lacked coherence. It felt like conversing with a bot that was trapped in a perpetual state of confusion.

Moreover, the app’s limited ability to handle context was a significant drawback. It frequently failed to maintain a coherent conversation thread, causing repeated misunderstandings and disjointed interactions. It lacked the ability to remember key details from previous exchanges, resulting in repetitive questions and disjointed replies that left me questioning its overall usefulness.

Another glaring issue was the app’s inability to grasp nuanced or complex queries. It often provided superficial and generic responses that felt like they were generated by a simplistic search engine rather than a sophisticated language model. It struggled with complex reasoning and failed to provide meaningful insights or deep understanding.

Furthermore, the app’s lack of empathy and emotional intelligence was highly evident. It failed to recognize and appropriately respond to emotional cues in the conversation. When expressing frustration or sadness, the app provided robotic and detached replies, further exacerbating my disappointment.

The app’s user interface also left much to be desired. It had a clunky design, with a convoluted menu structure that made navigation unnecessarily difficult. The overall user experience felt unintuitive and cumbersome, adding to the overall frustration of using the app.

Lastly, the lack of timely updates and improvements from the developers was disheartening. The app seemed stagnant, with no visible efforts to address the numerous flaws and enhance its capabilities. It gave the impression that customer feedback and satisfaction were low priorities.

In conclusion, the ChatGPT app was a thoroughly frustrating and disappointing experience. Its poor performance, limited context handling, inability to grasp complex queries, lack of empathy, subpar user interface, and stagnant development efforts all contribute to its well-deserved 1-star rating. I cannot recommend this app to anyone seeking a reliable and coherent conversational experience.

title: Estimado equipo de desarrollo de la aplicación ChatGPT
review:
Me gustaría sugerir una función que permita a los usuarios personalizar el nombre o la apariencia de la aplicación. Esto sería especialmente útil en entornos educativos donde algunos profesores pueden tener preferencias específicas en cuanto a las herramientas utilizadas en el aula. Creo que esta opción de personalización podría ayudar a que la aplicación sea más aceptada y utilizada por un público más amplio, al permitir a los usuarios adaptarla a sus necesidades y preferencias individuales.

Agradezco el trabajo que han realizado hasta ahora y aprecio la funcionalidad de la aplicación. Sin embargo, considero que esta mejora adicional podría hacerla aún más versátil y adecuada para diversos entornos educativos.

¡Gracias por su atención y consideración!

Atentamente, Angela Duque

title: 强大的智能助手与交互体验的完美结合
review:
OpenAI的ChatGPT iOS应用是一个非常强大和有用的工具。它是一个基于人工智能的语言模型，可以回答各种问题，提供信息和与用户进行对话。

首先，我要称赞它的智能和语言处理能力。它能够理解并回答复杂的问题，提供准确和详尽的回答。无论是技术性问题、文化知识还是实用建议，它总能给出令人满意的答案。

其次，这个应用非常易于使用。它的界面简洁明了，用户可以轻松提问并获得即时回复。对于那些需要快速解答问题或寻求帮助的人来说，这个应用是一个很好的选择。

此外，我还要提到它的适应能力。ChatGPT iOS应用可以根据用户的输入和反馈进行学习和改进，从而提供更加个性化和准确的回答。这种持续的学习使得它能够不断提升用户体验。

然而，正如所有的人工智能系统一样，它也有一些局限性。有时候，它可能会给出不完全准确或有误导性的答案。因此，在使用时我们仍然需要保持批判性思维，并结合其他信息进行判断。

总的来说，OpenAI的ChatGPT iOS应用是一个非常出色的工具。它能够为用户提供有用的信息和令人满意的回答，而且易于使用。它的智能和适应能力使得它成为一个强大的语言助手，可以帮助用户解决各种问题。

title: 中文评价
review: "ChatGPT iOS应用是一个值得拥有的工具，它具有无与伦比的语言模型能力，能够在各种情况下提供深思熟虑的回答。无论是寻求知识、解决问题、进行创意写作，或者只是进行友好的聊天，这个应用都表现得出色。不过，虽然它的人工智能模型非常强大，但有时候仍可能出现理解问题或回答不准确的情况，这是需要持续改进的地方。总体来说，这是一款高效、便捷、有趣的应用，使得人工智能的可能性成为现实。"

title: 令人惊叹的聊天体验！
review:
ChatGPT是我遇到的最先进的聊天智能助手之一。它的自然语言处理能力和回答问题的准确性令人印象深刻。我对其丰富的知识库和流畅的对话能力感到惊讶。无论是要寻求有关任何话题的信息，还是仅仅想与ChatGPT进行随机而有趣的对话，它总是提供出色的答案和个性化的回复。

ChatGPT不仅能够回答问题，还能适应我的语气和个人偏好。它的对话能力很自然，仿佛在与一个真实的人交流一样。我也很欣赏它的多领域知识，从科学和历史到流行文化和技术，它似乎对所有主题都有所了解。

此外，ChatGPT还具有令人满意的用户界面和简洁的设计。使用它非常简单，它的响应速度也非常快。无论我是想与它进行长时间的对话还是只是寻求快速的问题答案，它都能满足我的需求。

总的来说，ChatGPT是一款出色的聊天智能助手，它在为用户提供有趣、有用的对话体验方面表现出色。如果你正在寻找一个高质量的聊天伴侣和智能助手，我强烈推荐尝试ChatGPT！

title: 我是中国区用户
review: 你好 ChatGPT的管理员，我是中国区用户，很开心你们有了app，给我带来了极大的帮助，之前都是使用网页版手机沟通很不方便，现在很好，很有安全感，沟通也方便，我提个建议希望你们的界面可以有中文设置！还有就是我想开通plus会员，希望可以使用支付宝或者微信付款！我的账户是mangehhhh@gmail.com

title: 强大的生成式人工智能助手！
review:
我一直在寻找一款强大的生成式人工智能助手，而ChatGPT正是我一直以来所期待的！它在iOS平台上的发布使我能够随时随地享受到它的帮助。

首先，ChatGPT的智能回答让我惊叹不已。它能够理解我的问题，并提供详细和准确的答案。无论我是在寻求实时新闻、获取学术知识还是寻求日常生活建议，ChatGPT总能给予我最有帮助的回复。

此外，ChatGPT还具备出色的对话能力。它能够与我进行自然流畅的对话，就像与一个真实的人一样。这使得与ChatGPT交流变得有趣而且富有成效。无论是闲聊、解决问题还是寻找创意，ChatGPT都能提供恰当的回应。

最让我称赞的是ChatGPT对我的生活带来的巨大帮助。它为我提供了解答疑惑、解决难题和获取信息的便利途径。无论是学习、工作还是娱乐，ChatGPT总是能够满足我的需求。我真的不知道我在没有它的时候是如何生活的！

总而言之，我强烈推荐ChatGPT！它是一款令人惊叹的生成式人工智能助手，能够极大地改善您的生活。无论您需要什么帮助或建议，ChatGPT都能够为您提供准确、智能和个性化的回答。下载它，您绝对不会失望！

These contents were generated by ChatGPT, and I genuinely love this tool. It has helped me tremendously, and I’m grateful to every person on the team.😆

title: Not very good, and a bit insulting for $20/mo
review:
This app has potential, particularly when it comes to integration with shortcuts. However, as a tool for working with ChatGPT, especially for Plus users, it leaves much to be desired.

Most disappointingly, the app cannot use extensions unless the session is initiated from a web platform, and there's no option to edit your previous inputs for regeneration.

The inability to revise and resend your previous prompts severely limits the app's effectiveness for prompt development since there's no option for an edit/regenerate cycle. If you phrase something incorrectly and receive an odd response, there's no mechanism to rectify it. This renders the app more suitable for casual and simple interactions rather than anything more serious or intensive. 

There’s also a terrible design flaw that to copy or select text—the only way to export your results because OpenAI only implemented Share for the entire chat, and only to give you a useless URL you can post on Reddit—you have to pick that mode from a long press menu first. I’m not sure they were clear that in iOS, Share is the *only* real way to pass stuff between apps, and they just—skipped it. 

And then these rocket scientists put the “copy” and “select text” commands right by the “regenerate response” command. “Regenerate response” completely jettisons and replaces the prior text—with no confirmation.

I can’t tell you how many times I’ve erased what I was trying to copy so I could save it. That also erases the whole downstream thread, and you have to risk that a bunch of times per thread if you want to export your response text because this is the only way to do it. Way to throw away my quota.

So this app is useless for the professional work I’m paying $20/mo for, but it’s just great for posting a chat full of parody song lyrics to Reddit. And that’s as far as OpenAI has thought about their costly service.

At home, there’s the severe issue that if you use the ChatGPT Conversation Shortcut from Siri on HomePod, there’s no way to end the conversation. They apparently only tested it on phones where you have buttons to push, and not on HomePod, where it all has to be done voice. Any command you try to give the HomePod to cancel the shortcut (Siri, stop) will be answered by ChatGPT (buzz off, I’m not Siri).

Worse, it’ll just listen forever, responding to any question within earshot, until it decides to time itself out if it doesn’t hear any words for a bit. If you thought Echo was bad about waking up and sending your conversation to Amazon by mistake, you ain’t seen nothing yet.  

Whoever designed this paid no attention to user experience, user privacy, or the Apple ecosystem, so I assume it was an intern project or something. I certainly hope they didn’t pay anyone for this because I’m pretty sad I’m paying them for this.  

OpenAI needs to step up their game if they’re going to sell access to end users for $20(!!!!!) a month. This app doesn’t cut it, and they should be at least a little ashamed it’s this mediocre after taking so long to develop it.

title: API for paid GPT4 feels buggy
review:
Either the limit for API calls to GPT4 are too low or something about the app causes it to often get stuck cooking up a response. 

It is very common for me to have to close the app, reopen it, open history, reopen the last conversation, and then ask the same question I asked before the app got stuck.

I used to wait for like 10 seconds before going through this. Now I've learned that if it takes more than three seconds to output anything, that likely won't change at 10 seconds, 20 seconds, etc.

Word to the wise: Respond to any delay that's not due to a poor signal by closing and reopening the app. Can't wait for this to change.

That said, AMAZING app for studying a new technology. Imagine the best professor you had in college (or best high school teacher) and then imagine being able to ask them as many probing questions as you want without feeling like you're being annoying or delaying the lecture. Also, speaking of lectures, I think it's easier for me to remember details of a conversation (active) than a lecture or YouTube tutorial (passive). Truly fascinating.

title: Exceptional App for Streamlining Daily Tasks
review:
I can confidently say that this app has completely transformed the way I manage my daily tasks and stay organized. From the moment I started using it, I was blown away by its user-friendly interface and comprehensive features. This app has become an indispensable tool in my life.

First and foremost, the app's intuitive design makes it incredibly easy to navigate and use. Everything is neatly organized, and finding the features I need is a breeze. Whether it's creating to-do lists, setting reminders, or organizing my schedule, this app has it all covered.

What sets this app apart from others is its seamless synchronization across multiple devices. I can start a task on my smartphone and continue it on my tablet or computer effortlessly. This level of convenience has significantly improved my productivity and ensured I never miss a beat.

Moreover, the app offers a range of customizable options to tailor it to my specific needs. I can personalize task categories, color code important items, and set priority levels, allowing me to stay focused on what matters most. The app even provides insightful statistics and progress tracking, motivating me to reach my goals.

One aspect that truly impressed me is the exceptional customer support. The team behind this app is responsive, friendly, and always ready to help. Whenever I had a question or encountered a minor issue, their prompt assistance made me feel valued as a user.

In conclusion, this app has revolutionized the way I approach my daily tasks and has become an integral part of my life. Its user-friendly interface, seamless synchronization, customizable options, and excellent customer support make it a clear 5-star app. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking a powerful and efficient tool for managing their daily routines and boosting productivity.

(All I did was copy and paste. The app wrote the review.)

title: Good, and can become Great
review:
First, I really like the app and I’m now using it constantly. Thank you so much for making the app!

Now, for some ideas. I think the app could be way better if it facilitated various specific user stories: 
- as a GPT Plus user, I have many chats, it’s challenging to find stuff in them, so it’s really scattered, and I wish I could search my chat logs. 
- as someone who works with GPT on code projects, it would be incredible to have some integrated literate notebook programming features like runnable cells (maybe the plugins could help)
- as someone who pushes GPT to the limit, I often hit issues with context window, so it would be extremely useful if the interface simply drew a thick red line in the chat log at the start of the context window so we could see exactly what information will be available for the response. Perhaps that line would move depending on how long our messages are
- as someone who doesn’t have access to GPT4 on the API or Playground yet, I really feel like I can’t use GPT to the fullest extent, so I really wish I could set a system message and control various parameters like the playground makes available; it would be incredible if the system messages integrated ideas from Microsoft/guidance repo automatically, so we could write prompt templates with the handlebars syntax in the system message to guide the response formatting more clearly and efficiently 
- as an apple watch wearer, I would be thrilled to be able to send a message to chatgpt by talking to my watch, especially if it were integrated with a complication or the action button
- as an Apple customer, I can see how chatgpt integration with the Shortcuts app would potentially be revolutionary; we could enable routines with this; 
- as a prompt engineer, it feels like a lot of flipping back and forth between this app and 1Writer (great app btw) to manage the prompts and paste them around; it would be nice to have a prompt library both personal and public and perhaps make it easy to toggle prompts between private by default and public for others, especially if it had great version history; then when the prompts are updated everyone can use the latest version easily
- a close family member of mine uses an iPad Pro a ton, and as an iPad Pro user, they would really love it if there were a real iPad UI to use the big screen to the fullest and not have to use the janky scaled-up iPhone app (which is less fun and impressive than this app deserves to be)
- finally, as an AI user, I think it would be great if I could plug in my own data sources to a vector database and connect that to chatgpt without needing a third party; I’d love to chat with my Evernote, notion, Dropbox, drive, web history, messages, basically I wish I could index all my data and search it to pull relevant chunks for gpt if needed.

I’m sure there are more ideas, but imho, if you guys implemented these, you’d have a professional level app and it would be even more revolutionary than it already is! 

Thank you for taking the time to read this,

Bion

title: Less features than the web version
review:
There are less features than the web version of ChatGPT. (This review doesn’t speak for subscription versions.)

1. You cannot go back and edit prompts in a conversation. 
2. You cannot clear conversations.
3. Light/Dark theme is system based, there is no toggle.
4. No “Chat History & Training” Setting in the settings.
5. No examples/capabilities/limitations in the background of a new chat.

That’s all  the features not present on the mobile version that I could find.
Some features that are new or different are:

1. A “Haptic feedback” Setting
2. The box ChatGPT puts code, ascii, etc. is instead in a patch of tinted background.
3. Speech-to-Text.

Overall, not much is new/different. Some features from the web version are missing however. It’s ChatGPT however, so it gets 5 ⭐️. I would personally use the web version over the app as of now. This review doesn’t speak for the subscription features.

P.S. Have a good day everyone!

title: Fantastic App with Room for Enhancements
review:
The ChatGPT iOS app is an outstanding product. Its seamless functionality and user-friendly interface provide an exceptional user experience. The AI’s proficiency in maintaining a conversational flow and its ability to comprehend and generate accurate responses is truly commendable.

However, I believe there is scope for improvement to make this great app even better. Firstly, it would be immensely beneficial to add a browsing feature. This would enable users to quickly cross-reference information within the app, enriching the overall user experience.

Secondly, supporting plug-ins would greatly increase the app’s versatility. It would allow users to customize their experience and adapt the app to a wider range of applications.

Lastly, incorporating a code interpreter would be a game-changer. This feature could aid users in debugging code, learning new programming languages, or even automating tasks.

In summary, ChatGPT is an excellent app that has revolutionized communication with AI. With a few enhancements, I believe it has the potential to become an indispensable tool for a vast array of users. Looking forward to seeing these updates soon!
